oMjMxpYR12LEXYu5m_rqmg.review_text: Went here for my girl's grad celebration. Of course finding parking sucks around 10pm on a Saturday night in the city, especially with all the restaurants and clubs in this area. Took us about 30 minutes of driving just to find parking a couple blocks away (just a warning so you can give yourself enough time). Seems like a spot for party bus peeps too, when we went, a group about 30 people got into line from a party bus. If you're on the guest list, I'd try to get there early, like 10-10:30 to give yourself enough time to get in without having to pay the $20 cover (guest list closes at 11pm)  Once inside, music wasn't too shabby. I had a great time. Seemed like the music in the front room was a little better (more old school) than the back room, but of course the back room has so much more space. Never felt like I didn't have enough space to dance, which is good because the last thing I need is some girl's sweaty back rubbing against my arm. Drinks are typically priced, bout $10 for a Goose and Cran. Asked for a double shot of Henn for my girl and it was $14, but it was literally like half a cup of Henn. lol. Bartender in the front was attentive and worked fast.  Not bad at all. Would come back.

R9TIWPBlMuzzWgYXZBnAlg.review_text: nice crowd ... doorman let me slide in on relaxed dress code ... d.j was banging out hits & bartender was n the mix like a blender ... i enjoyed my time and would go again

ydNRRZrATh99osddko5Bog.review_text: From what I can remember. . .  Because trust me, it really wasn't a lot, since I was drunker than drunk, it was pretty cool.  I came here for a private event and it was a sizable place.  I can't really review much on the downstairs, but the upstairs was pretty tight.  I think they got two stages, no?  Or maybe, just one. And it was really dark.  But then again, that was probably me on the verge of passing out.    Hmmmmm. . .  Gotta give props to those bartenders  if your dranks got me to that level.  HEEY!!

yhzb5adgzluN8O12rl6d8Q.review_text: I went here with Christine B. (see her review below).  I will give it 4 stars because here in New York I am deprived of...space.  I liked the venue, but let me start from the beginning.    We got there decently early (before 10:30) to get in for "free" before 11.  Of course the line didn't budge.   Our friend did get on the guest list, but we as his appendages only got a discount (decent though).    We walk in and the first floor has a bar, a lounge area, and is rather cramped.  I thought this was the whole of the club (hahaha I am telling you I am just expecting of cramped spaces bc of NYC).  Anyways, we make our way to the 2nd floor and the dance floor is (to me) incredibly spacious.  I was sort of appalled.  And it's air-conditioned.  And you don't have to shove your way through people.  So awesome.    The DJ looked like he was 50 though....and he played some horrible music in the beg.  The first floor had greaat music.  But throughout the night we just kept going back and forth, and eventually the music on the 2nd floor got better (as in more top 40 ish).    The crowd is....alright.  But all you need is good friends and good music and this place has potential.

Z88rSP-Kn1aK7MwRYir1og.review_text: Stopped by for a quick visit.  This used to be the old Zebra lounge.  Everything still looks the same.  No real changes from previous club name. The back room still has plenty of room. HUGE!  DJ had some house/trance music in the back room and there were a lot of Euro guys bouncing around.  The front room, a bit smaller I believe they had hip hop/r&b/pop.

VCoBNwAUSvo0Sz2ORszOOw.review_text: I come here only for their Fashion Events and Musical Guests (Jeremih, Jay Sean, etc).  There are just better clubs out there.

-072yGcrQlizY7urNgquSg.review_text: I was looking at a bunch of the yelp reviews before I rolled here this past Saturday night and most of them were from the early part of Winter, so I wasn't quite sure what to expect.  First, parking on Broadway was terrible. We weren't down to park and pay because we'd much rather use that money for drinks at the bar, and spent nearly 25 minutes looking for a spot. If you've ever been to the City, you know there's a buttload of one way streets, so this definitely took away from party time. There were a bunch of po (aka police) out, and hella meters on Broadway were blocked off. When we finally found parking it was nearly 4 blocks away. Now, I'm always down for a walk but -- ladies can back me up -- it is VERY difficult to walk up a hill IN HEELS and look cute...especially when you need to pee and you're not drunk enough to do it in public.  Guest list ends at 11 and since parking took a lot longer than expected (yeah, we were super annoyed with that situation), we didn't make it. On the plus side, there was no line by the time we conquered that hill. Cover was pretty expensive ($20) but we managed to mouth piece the girl and she let us in for $15. At the same time, though, the girl might've been a beezy because the bouncer, who was really nice, told us there wasn't cover since it was so late. I guess we'll never know...  I don't think there's a dress code. If there is, it's not strict. I saw some fool wearing a North Face jacket zipped up to his chin.  All the past reviews said the bathrooms were clean, and those were lies! The ladies room was a mess...hella mystery liquids on the floor, paper towels everywhere, and 1 of the faucets (out of 2) was broken. There's are some cushes for tushes though, so you can holla at that if your booty is tired of backing it up.  The DJ was alright. His mixing was horrible, the flow was awkward. He played artist blocks quite a few times (I remember 3 MJ songs in a row. RIP, homie). The dance floor is gigantic and the DJ does his best to keep it moving. The ambiance is similar to the club in Knocked Up, so if you're inner sexy Katherine Heigl or geeky Seth Rogen wants to come out, embrace it. There was a good mix of people and the vibe (other than one creepy drunk fool) was cool. Having gone with low expectations, it turned out to be a really good night. I don't think it's really worth the $20 cover so try and get in via guestlist. The fun factor would increase if you roll deep with your folks.  Last thing, their AMFs get the job done and they don't even taste bad!

Nq1OAJRt3p7xZv0CNEzKXw.review_text: I've been in play mode!  Making the most of my winter break, and my waistline is paying for it -_-  Christmas day, yes I went out Christmas day, just to show some support to my Synergy folks.  I wasn't in the Christmas spirit this year, not at all.  I felt like the grinch..so what better way than to get f'd up and forget about everything?  I spent XMas eve with the fam..don't get me wrong.    Atmosphere wasn't that packed, but that was expected...we knew that all the people out would be the ones that don't really celebrate Christmas, aka fobs (HAHA no offense to anyone..I don't mean this in a goo wok jai sense either..).  We did bottle service that night - oj & cranberry juices were watered down..but damn we sure did drink a lot that night.  VIP lounges are nice and comfy, a lot more open than Boss but not as many booths or whatever.  From what I can remember, music was good, bathrooms were clean..and most people there were my friends so no creeper issues.    Go back?  Yes.  Grey Goose ALL night?  No.

QCW7PMwU8JAaKKC02FN4mQ.review_text: When I was in elementary school I watched a movie about cattle stockyards. You know, those places where they house and horde to-be-eaten cows into a mass before shuttling them off to be butchered and devoured?   As I milled into Atmosphere I definitely felt like one of the cows being pushed into an assembly line. Sealed on lock step, being pushed by a gruff and relatively unfriendly bouncer, I expected to be led into a slaughterhouse or an interrogation chamber where I would be repeatedly asked for my papers or the location of the rebel base.  Okay, that's a bit much. But seriously, Atmosphere is a horribly packed venue. Dancing when only the downstairs is open is remarkably impossible. The practice of doing anything other than stepping left, right, and just wedging yourself against six other people is literally like an interview question I got at Google once. And much like the Google question I got, it's really hard to come out on top. NP-Hard in fact.  The back bottle service room is better and bottles at Atmosphere are comparatively cheap. But the "ambiance" is a little lacking, given that the last time I was there the guy at the table next to me just started wretching with the full desperation of someone who called poison control after they swallowed something like weaponized ebola. What's worse is that homie was exploring the contents of his stomach for nearly twenty minutes until the waitresses and the bouncers decided to escort him outside. It was kind of like watching a race car crash on Nascar.  Look, I'm sure Atmosphere isn't a bad place per se. I'm sure if you're blacked out drunk you might have a lot more fun getting hot and moving 3ft/hr on the dance floor. But I don't like rolling to places where I have to kill a can of pre-ban FourLoko before I'm something similar to enjoying myself.

pua1YEWvJcUu8WkR-O_Vbg.review_text: This place is absolutely horrible... I paid to get bottle service and when I arrived the club was completely DEAD. Karen the "events specialist" was totally unprofessional and regret ever dealing with her. There were literally about 5 people in the club and they did nothing to try to accommodate us. I am disappointed and I would NOT recommend this place to anyone. Completely ruined my birthday.

w501uxxLr-q5FGNpMI1Zsg.review_text: I came here for a Kollaboration event so it was pretty much 85% asians - not sure if that's representative of a typical night though.  Bouncer: decently nice  Music: the bottom area had hip hop which I appreciated.  The other room has more pop-y music so if that's your thing. then. good for you.  Drinks: not sure how much it is... I didn't pay  The Wait: get in line around 10:20.  Even though it took us past 11 to get in (by a few minutes), they let us in for free on the guestlist.  Overall it was just okay.  I wasn't feeling the crowd - probably wouldn't come back again.

LPkXc94_xyRN09d8sXSR7Q.review_text: When the line gets long here, you end up waiting in an alley that smells quite nasty... I suggest you get here earlier at like 10 to avoid being in the stinky alley. The club left me with really bad first impressions from the way it looked on the outside - super grungy like you were going into some sort of dungeon.   Upon entering - Atmosphere is a pretty big club with multiple dance floors playing various types of music in each room. They have multiple bars and the drinks are standard. The crowd can vary from casual to dress to impress - once the bouncers start letting people in they pretty much let anyone in and the crowd can get really sketchy. I don't know, but this has been the ultimate creeper experience in SF that i've had. Too many eager beaver guys coming out of nowhere!

tfg1Nhwx94Y4GdQHLVawbw.review_text: Great job with the remodeling job. I went from a warehouse to a nicer warehouse. But seriously its way better in terms of looks and feel but North Beach is just a trashy area.

4an_jbW1wyOt3GC4gk6GaQ.review_text: A big-@$$ "THANK YOU" to Atmosphere (especially Bennett!) for helping to make my "--th" birthday the BEST one yet!!!  If any of y'all need a nice and relatively new venue in SF to throw yourself a kick-@$$ birthday party, I'd definitely recommend Atmosphere.    After my last review, Bennett (co-owner) contacted me to get some feedback on the venue, the music, etc.  Coincidentally, I was conducting my annual "Where in the heck should I throw my birthday party?!" research so, I paid another visit to Atmosphere.  Bennett is SO sweet and SO accommodating.  He showed me various sections of the club which would be ideal for a 50+ person birthday party.  I chose the roped-off VIP area behind the DJ on the main dance floor.  It's large enough to accommodate at least 50-75 guests, and it's surrounded by couches - a perfect lounge-y area right next to the dance floor.  Instead of charging me an arm, a leg and my firstborn just to use the space, he provided several options for renting it out.  Since my friends and I are not fans of bottle service, Bennett proposed a flat fee, no need for bottle service (compared to other venues, the flat fee was relatively inexpensive - and I'm sure I could have negotiated it down if I hadn't been lazy about it).  All my guests received free admission/no cover, and there was even a dedicated bouncer for the section which had been roped-off for my birthday!  [Note: The bouncer did his job a little too well - some of my friends weren't able to get past him without special wristbands!!]    Bennett even provided tables for the cakes my friends brought, and I think he even provided utensils.  No charge for any of the special set-up.  The only reason I am not giving Atmosphere five stars is because, well, the music was still not quite right.  The DJ was really sweet and friendly, though!  But he played a lot of remixed stuff and techno which was sort of Pop/Top40 but not quite; and he barely played hip-hop.  Fortunately, most of my friends were too drunk to care.  The DJ was also missing a mic so, no birthday shout-out for me. :(    Other than that, no complaints.  Thanks again, Bennett and Atmosphere, for making this birthday the best one yet!!

IgSg9e9D_NLsqTI_bRlu4w.review_text: This North Beach spot gets four stars for hosing the "Ripple" benefit last Friday.  I was a little apprehensive because it is the ex-Zebra Lounge, a place that i went to four years ago!...and i swore i would never set foot in a north beach club again...but for charity, why not?  By doing this benefit...Atmosphere really gave me a look at the potential of the space...it took out the "typical" north beach crowd...filled it with clean good looking young professions...and POOF! a great looking space emerged!   the upstairs room was perfect for the huge crowd that was in attendance...the new side room on the first level was a great addition!  Decor, Lights, Bars were great.  Would i come again? yes, if they pulled a young professional crowd again..Big Ups for hosting a benefit here!

_q_MC7ebjDOCpX5Ec7TXEQ.review_text: What's the difference between Atmosphere and Zebra Lounge? Ohhh..that's right. just the name. it's exactly the same as it was before.  I went here recently for "The Spa" promises of makeovers and free massages...when i got there, i felt like i was at an office party..everybody was stacked in little cliques and groups, just chatting with their champagne. Nobody was dancing, nobody was mingling...  I went over to find the "spa" area, and what i found was 1 chair massage, and 2 girls working out of a portable makeup case giving makeovers under 1 flourescent light!! are you kidding me?!  Flourescent light?! that's the best you can do? and guess where they chose to put the "spa" area? right outside the bathrooms. Wonderful.   The claim of having a soothing beautiful reef tank was an absolute joke. there were 3 fishes. count them. 1, 2, 3. and a few seaweed looking plants.  Yea, my goldfish tank has more personality..if i had a goldfish tank...  i think this club needs A LOT of work before it can pick up and get on solid ground.  The security was solid, but kind of off putting that they need to swipe your ID and take your picture before they let you in?? Doesn't really give me peace of mind..Would i go back? Not anytime soon..ask me in another 6 months..if they are still around.

w-US6FCjLJvqTiRsnQz89w.review_text: Definitely depends on who throws the event and who is the DJ. Do your research.  The couple times I went, it was packed because I knew who the event coordinators were and the place is spacious. The theme itself of having 3 different types of "atmospheres", hence the name, is a little lame. But I did have fun every single time I went! I loved the biggest dance floor room the best.    The decor never really changes, but the crowd and the music does. I did happen to go there on a slow night, where they only kept the front parts opened. It was a little awkward, but the DJ (DJ Romeo) kept the music playing and I had fun dancing.  The service is always nice, except those stuffy bouncers, but the rest of the people were friendly and smiley.

V-MvohG15HHEJAvljBqc7A.review_text: Pretty cool place, you can tell that they put a lot of money into the remodel.  I went on a night where my friends were hosting the party and they had an open bar to promote a new vodka called Devotion.  So I decided to drop in and see what was good.  I thought that since they had open bar I would have to fight my way to get a drink, but the bartender was hella koo, it was just him behind the bar the whole time and he got everyone what they wanted.  I left early and my friend told me when I did, all the hot girls started rolling in...story of my life.

Nj_9hGPd6BdimYQdx3Pyjg.review_text: went here friday for sisters 21st second floor closed good music small crowd bouncers kicked us out after 40 minutes this place was not crackin  the only good thing was the music was sick

Xq2MDSoxP8TUL1gRZF58Rw.review_text: This has to be the worst club I have ever been to. I have been to a lot of shitty clubs and bars but this one takes the cake. Before arrival we were promised fast and free entry and when we did arrive not only did we have to wait in line for 30 mins we were told we were no longer allowed to enter the club at all. After watching hoards of ghetto people rush there way in we finally decided to speak to the manager to see why we had to wait in the "VIP" line when everyone else was getting in. The security guards were power tripping and just yelled stupid meat head shit to us.  There are so many other clubs to go to in the city please don't waste your time here.

v8wXnLb4164G6xErO4s3ZQ.review_text: So I was also dragged to this club on the same day the Hult b-school folks decided to turn up there. I was not apart of their cohort, because we actually had VIP and i didn't see that any of them did (they wore their pink badge ropes the entire night). However, I will say what yelp reviewer "Jennifer C" is too polite to say lol!  Those "aggressive, ghetto gropy" guys she complains of were all black dudes. Of course no one would have been complaining had they both looked like and had the bankroll of, say, Kobe Bryant or someone like that. And neither would I. The fact is, I like black men because I'm not self hater, but maybe the combination of the incredibly profane and sexual music and the way the club is ran by management brought out the worst in everyone's behavior. The club knows exactly what it is doing. The idea I got was that the horny guys who come from all the titty bars are welcome here to close by the end of the night. There is really no other reason to totally ignore their "cocktail attire" strictly enforced on their website by letting poorly dressed folks come in, black and white; and have the DJ repeat songs that reiterate "f**king and sucking" all night long. There were some nice songs that played in between the ratch but it just seemed out of place at that point. Honestly, the vibe of the guys there was definitely too aggressive. Funny thing is, no one really groped me or harassed me because I look like a huge "B", which works for me sometimes. I love to dance and felt I couldn't get room to effing breathe let alone dance. If you're gangster and not easily shook then come here and get ratch because that's exactly what youre gonna get lol. If you're afraid and easily intimidated by 'urban' men lol, go somewhere else where you'll feel better and more secure.   One silver lining was this gorgeous Asian man employee (security?) with long dreads. He was very patient, forgiving and professional. Bless you Sir

bLLpAJ5ia_Bq170E0jZdOQ.review_text: If this place was located anywhere else but North Beach, then it would  be a must-stop for anyone wanting to dance the night away or just lounge. With three rooms and one large dance hall, Atmosphere is a very pleasant location on your eyes. Your wallet and eardrums will be a different story.   The crowd on the night we went was diverse, but its easy to see how the infamous Contra Costa Valley Girl/Dude Guy crowd can inflitrate the place.   I'll be honest, the house DJ sucked! The majority of DJs understand the concept of maintaining a constant dance beat to keep the crowd moving...    One of the downsides of this place is that it has to abide by the city sancation NORTH BEACH LAST CALL meaning the party ends at 2am. No questions asked. Booooo....

aUNghAOA2JL7HOnbh-GD4Q.review_text: I like this place. I usually come here for Russian parties. The DJ's are cool, the bartenders are fat enough, there's a place to sit - which is very important))  To those, who couldn't find the restroom on the second floor, go straight ahead and it's on your left ^_^

NpU44ANnUUNQWY4U0eUGvA.review_text: i used to come here back in the day when it was called zebra.  then it was called lattitude.  now atmosphere.  a3 or whatever.    the side room can get insanely hot if there are a lot of people in there.  it is not well ventilated at all.  the main room is a giant square.  for those who wear stilettos beware, there is a grate right in front.  so if you think you are hot enough to bypass the line and show off your boobies to the bouncer/promoter be careful not to get your heel stuck in the grate. or just wait in line in that alley like a normal person

WJBj7fmt_MJER6HY5IZx2A.review_text: My birthday was a few Fridays ago and I wanted to make sure that my friends and I had a great time in SF, so I did my research.  I had a party of 20+ with me and wanted to find a club big enough and friendly enough to accommodate all of us.  I emailed around to various North Beach and SOMA clubs, and Karen, the manager from Atmosphere in North Beach, got back to me first with rates about table service, guest list info, etc.  Karen was very friendly through email and we had several exchanges.  She even knocked down the price for a $250 bottle of Belvedere to $150.  I decided that this was a steal so 12 from my group signed up for the VIP table service and threw in another bottle of Patron (at regular price).  She also let me know that the rest of my group (the other 10 people) would be "taken care of" and sure enough we were all on the guest list, all got in for free, and were all given wristbands for the VIP tables.  Talk about great service!    We were given the best booths in the house for all 22 of us! (Only 12 did the actual drinking from the bottles though).  And just our luck that night they had a special of $5 Belvedere cocktails from 10-11pm, so my non-table service friends were able to enjoy themselves just fine! The DJ was great that night.  They had a special video DJ event going on where they projected music videos onto all the club walls, which created an awesome atmosphere (no pun intended).  The DJ played a great mix of old school hip hop and current top 40 hits.  It was awesome! I think the best part was that it wasn't overcrowded and you could actually move through the dance floor and have enough room to truly break it down!! And, oh did I get down... ;)  All my friends were raving about the club the next day.  I've been to my share of clubs around North Beach and few have service as good as Atmosphere's.  The music, the club staff, the drinks were all great and my group left very, very satisfied.  We didn't have to deal with douchey bouncers nor were we packed into the club like sardines.  So contrary to all the 2 star reviews you see below I give Atmosphere a stellar rating.  I highly recommend coming to Atmosphere with a large group and getting in contact with Karen King the next time you go clubbing and want VIP service.  It definitely made for a memorable birthday, that's for sure....Cheers!

pnfVIB7UhvCQ7X2K0Q2XIw.review_text: Yes, crowd in the back is pretty ghetto. (I think that's the hip hop room). Luckily there are two front rooms. One with trance that no one dances to, and another room to the side to lounge around in. The bathrooms are way too small though for that capacity.

_yntN5c3jV9gBWUfAhOp0g.review_text: I've been here twice.  Both times have been ridiculous.  Both times there was a large line out front, both times it moved quickly.  Both times, I've had A LOT of fun.  Both times, I have had drinks spilled on me.  Both times, I have enjoyed the music. Okay, enough of that.  Overall, a fun club for a Saturday night.  Good music, fast bartenders, fun crowd!  Bathroom's kinda sketch, though.

d-JOIH4H8NfEh-cFRe81gw.review_text: Went there on the first Sat of the month.  First time at this place so decide to arrive before Happy Hour (selective drinks only) ended 11pm.  A friend knew the promoter which got us in quickly so thats a plus.  Saved me $20.    Pros:  Upstairs dance floor is one of the bigger ones in the city.  Great vibe with the whole club dancing.    Cons:  Location Location Location, parking can be a pain.  Younger crowd and don't expect it to be diverse. Majority asian.  Music was So-So upstairs, expected more hip hop instead of mixing the songs short.    Would go again for the big dance floor but wouldn't be my first choice.

xc6SGcbtsv0WiTMytmL6Vg.review_text: Friday night isn't all that great but Saturday night is better. they open up the top floor and more people to meet. drinks ok. beer is $6 and mix drinks are $12 shot not sure. then crowd are mostly Mexican and A-American with some what Asian.  the line is long sometime depends.   parking is bad like any other club spots unless you want to pay $20 parking across the street or down the block.  there are always police outside waiting for you if you are too drunk. i really mean tons of police. if you are to drunk, they will arrest you even if you are with your friends and they are taking care of you.   over all its ok

bgesHJxTeDFertyFrLmvaQ.review_text: I was lead here under false pretenses that there was Free entry to Beer Pong Olympics. After waiting outside in the rain for 15 minutes we get to the front of the line. The bouncer tells us it costs $5 to get in and gave us 5 beer vouchers and some Team number. We took the "beer vouchers" up to the bar where they told us we could get $1 PBRs for the Beer Pong Olympics- What a ripoff. So, $10 later I was playing beerpong with a bunch of random dudes from the hostel across the street against more dudes from the same hostel.   Only go here if you like being lied to, enjoy drinking PBR, listen to bad music, and hate women.   0 stars. I will never go here again.

Wh2Y4k8MPPvBAGoRu4WCNw.review_text: I usually rate bars/clubs based on how much fun I had and I must say we had a great time here! We came for my friend's 25th birthday and Mase was performing that night.   We came early to avoid paying cover. It was free with guestlist before 10:30pm. At 9:45-10:00ish, there was no line so we got in easily. As it got later, the club got more packed and the line got longer. Some of my friends had to pay $25 cover because they arrived a little after 10:30pm but they said the line was moving.   This place has two bars, one when you first walk in and the other one is upstairs. There's also a small room on the right for bottle service tables. So there are 3 separate areas for you to hang out at. It's not a huge place but it's decent-sized.   The bartenders were also nice. One of them charged us an extra $3 by accident and we honestly didn't even realize but he owned up to it on his own. He even offered to give us 2 more shots of what we had ordered to make up for it. That was not what I expected but I am definitely grateful for that!  It was a fun night at Atmosphere and we loved dancing the night away to the hip hop!

8Az6AHVoOaF9dBH6HzD5gg.review_text: Yesterday night our group of 4 were planning on going to Monroe next door, but lots of attitude from the doormen got us walking down the street and I'm glad we did! From the awesomely chill Benny out front to Cesar in the back, the staff made it known they wanted us to have a good time.   When going to a club all I really care about is the music and the crowd: crowd was friendly and diverse, and the music was good and there was a lot of dancing for everyone. You don't go to North Beach anticipating lots of parking and squeaky clean establishments (it's the freaking red light district!), you go for straight up partying. Guys should prepare to pay cover if not on guestlist (was $10 last night). There was no line at 10:30pm on a Friday night, and plenty of room to move around. No fights or ghetto feel and hopefully it stays that way for our future nights out here!

9wg-OPI3dYkMR_tOC26yCQ.review_text: Jeez, I really can't catch a break with the venues on Broadway. This place is the old Zebra Lounge resurrected with trashier crowd.   From a decor standpoint, I have to give the new owners credit for upgrading the place. The venue is pretty large to host corporate events, but unfortunately, the crowd that attends this club is reminiscent of Sutra next door.   Sure, I've been here on more than 4 occasions, but that was only because I've had bottle service discounts from my cousin who knows the owners.  The drinks are reasonably priced, but you have to ask yourself if you're willing to spend less on drinks for a ghetto crowd.  As for bartenders, look for Brenda...she's my homegirl who's not only hot, but makes it a point to get you tipsy.

kgH3K0hWgE41cjUtO9wMQQ.review_text: Hella creepers, the bouncers are unfriendly and rude...and not cute to redeem themselves.  The bartenders are OK, the drinks were strong, but the atmosphere at Atmosphere left something to be desired.  I'm sure there should have been more than just the one crowded area for dancing, that was roughly the size of my living room. After watching several strings of men hitting on, and trying to dance with many girls, it just got tiring.   If being molested by creepers is up your alley, then perhaps you should come here. Though, the club pretty much clears out around 1:15, closing around 2. Probably a good idea, considering all the other clubs around the area, cater to those of the male population who believe violence is the answer (that means they all went outside to fight about whatever they were angry about, probably someone made a snide comment about their haircuts, or stepped on their shoes, y'know important stuff)  The staff (bouncers and coat check) are rude, they yell about almost everything, "Don't lean on that post, even though it's holding our building up" "Don't put your drink on the one table we have in the dancing area, because someone might use it to smash someone on the head", etc.  Apparently this is where sloppy drunks come to fling their alcoholic beverages, because I got about three drinks spilled on me. This makes sense considering it's the party bus's go-to venue, and drunk people cannot hold their liquor (that's funny, ahahaha punny)

TH_RbQROSJyT-OccDOINWw.review_text: Atmosphere is one of my normal "to-go" places when we can't think of anywhere else to go.  It gets 3 stars (probably 3 1/2).  Depending on who is promoting and who is DJ'ing - the night can vary from a 2 star place to a 4 star place.  One thing to mention is that there is not much ventilation in this place.  Recently I noticed they started putting fans up by the bar to get the circulation going.    There is a dance area right when you walk in the door and then also a larger dance floor and bar in the back.  My opinion only, but the music is usually better in the front section and gives you a little more room to dance.    One reason I continue to come back is my favorite bartender in SF!  JAMES!!! Awesome bartender, great personality, treats us to some flair and tricks every once and a while, even got him to take a shot with me on my bday!!! =)  Definitely a reason I keep coming back!

7esPoDyIOt5PxJdoi2Ek2Q.review_text: I went there on NYE and it was TERRRIBLE. It was mad expensive when you bought tickets near the end. Almost $100. yet for some reason there was still a huge line out the door that wrapped around into the alley.   The COAT CHECK was full! And this was especially terrible because I came there with a bag of what I needed in order to sleep over at a friend's place on the night of NYE. I don't understand how you can have the nerve to sell so many tickets that your own freaking coat check becomes full. Clearly a sign of them overselling to the point of not caring about each person's individual experience.  Lastly, the music stunk. They were playing really old music that wasn't even from 2010 and "DJ Tina" didn't seem to do any unique mixing or mashing. Just seemed like a random assortment of top 40 from the past decade or so.

ivG4VgMLNGf_wF1CIA1-Ww.review_text: So the bartenders are quick, but thats probably because the place was empty untill a bus load of people showed up.   1 star for the bartender , 1 star for the venue design but minus 3 stars for the shit crowd and for being n Broadway.

NF7_K38Hc6G4R3hvEhT0dw.review_text: There's basically 2 rooms - the dance floor and the lounging area which consists of only 3 long chairs.  The DJ sucked yet the bartenders were good.  The only thing I could rave about is the chill crowd.

mdCAsnSP3uCH2859UYW66A.review_text: I appreciate management reaching out, however, what's done is already done and we'll move forward from here.

j4zFnMgGLCSmz2yJZTIt0Q.review_text: I've been here a couple times with my friends and have always had a great time! The staff was always accommodating especially with bottle service, which I must say is very affordable compared to some other places in SF. I also came here once for a friends private wedding reception, there was a henna person and a caricaturist! Great place for a night out on the town or if you need a space to rent for something private.

4pzr6KuS85859EICMI7MDw.review_text: I don't know what the neighborhood club standard is in North Beach, but I'd rather sip on a $6 Corona elsewhere. It's like the bartender sighed every time he rung us up for a drink, as if he was embarrassed. Very overpriced. At least Ruby Skye can get away with charging this much.  They don't have Heineken -- only Stella, Anchor Steam and Corona. They don't have Belvedere -- only three kinds of Grey Goose.  The space is nice, kind of concrete and modern looking with intense disco lights in the main room in the back. I was a little confused why there were four motorcycles in the entry way in the first room (which was entirely dead). Also, this is the first and only club I've had to have a digital picture taken of me and have my ID scanned at the door. Yes, I am of age!  I actually enjoyed the music in the back room for the Russian party I went to here since it was more house and breaks oriented with some trance thrown in here and there, probably only for the Russian crowd. My alter ego of the night was Olga and my companion was Gorbachev.  Not bad. Just not great.

xbeC5Uir71wzdNad64PSDQ.review_text: Ok, so everyone knows that club bouncers and security guards are ridiculously rude and mean by nature, but this guy from Atmosphere tops the list! I think he's Hispanic but i'm not exactly sure, anyways, he totally ruined my night! He was rude, mean, nasty, ugly, and all of the above! He was yelling at my friends and I like we killed his mother. The reason why he was yelling was because of where we were standing, but it was the other security guard who was standing next to him that told us to stand there in the first place. I don't know if he was deaf or just looking to take his anger out on somebody! The GM happens to step out and we did not hesitate to speak our mind. He said that dude was covering for one of his regular security guard's shift last minute. Yes, the GM apologized and I appreciated it, but sorry, it did not help our dissatisfaction at all.   This is an example of how one little mishap can ruin an entire organization's reputation.  Description of the A-hole: tall, big, Hispanic looking guy, with a greased pony tail

e4c5ah4-mL6EtV-yKxVtpw.review_text: Never coming back here again. I only came here for bottle service for my birthday and I heard my friends were also going here. I reserved one bottle of Jameson and got a table on the main room. Beware because it is located on Broadway, parking is a bitch! Come way early for parking. Anyways, I've never been here before and when I got the email from the lady stating strict on dress code, I expected it wouldn't be too ghetto. When I got there it was ghetto as fuck! As if there wasn't any dress code.   PROS -bottle service area requires wristbands with the group and is a ropes off area, which was nice as the rest of the club was crowded and grimey!  CONS -The line for bottle service is just as long as the guest list line! -they say there is a strict dress code but don't even follow it -the bouncers are extra douschy and rude here -the waiter for the bottle service table sucked. She just brought over my bottle with some sparklers and dipped. Never came back to pour drinks or check on us. I had to look and ask for her hella times! She was also hella rude.  -I asked for my card and ID back hella times prior to drinking in the beginning and she said, "Already?" And I said yes! I hev had bottle service before and they usually give the check ASAP, especially since you're drinking, duh! I ain't stupid. It wasn't until the middle-end of the night til I got my cards back. -bottle of Jameson total was $270ish and it was a regular bottle, not the extra big one from Costco, smh. You can go to Parlor for the exact price for the Costco size Jameson -__- -creepers galore!

HgRHN0jVVsTwuhqqtnQGsQ.review_text: Came here last Saturday with a group of friends. We got bottle service (only after which the bouncers were nice to us when they knew).  There's the big dance floor room and then there's a room where most people can lounge at their tables. Both rooms blast music and I preferred the music closer to the entrance (but that isn't the dance floor...) I wasn't impressed with the music but it may have been the DJ that night. There's a mixed crowd, mostly on the younger side.  Parking is awful. My friend, who frequents Atmosphere more than I do, suggested we park at least 2 blocks away. Yes, it's cold and far, but you're unlikely to find parking close to the club.  Cover is usually 20 dollars. Guest list free before 11 PM. I suggest you get there EARLY if you don't want to pay cover. Bouncers will hold the line so people cannot get in before 11 and you'll have to pay the 20 anyways.   Overall, I wasn't impressed. Music meh. Drinks meh. People meh.

eHD5APzlAuRTUKkJaXNxEQ.review_text: I LOVE THIS PLACE...   The staff is so attentive! We had reserved the VIP section of the cub for my 30th birthday. Needless to say we had bottle service, with about 6 bottles of Remy and 1 bottle of Southern Comfort, their host Karen was unbelievably responsive and super attentive. There wasn't one person there that wasn't having a good time. This is definitely my favorite spot in the city.

l0lmpWZzTP2zy5_eI6ZFMw.review_text: This is a cool club to party, dance and chill with friends over the weekend. But what's even cooler about this venue is the fact that they have a good line up of artist performing on specific nights. For instance, I was here for their Halloween House of Horror party and the highlight of the night was when Pharcyde performed live on the stage! It was great to see them since I used to listen to this Oldschool  hip hop group in the early 90's!  Other than the ambience, decor, floor space, the crowd is friendly and so are the bartenders. Plus the bottle service staff is awesome!  They always accommodate me or my friends for bottle service table if we ask for one!

SZL3ufRBEqHXHTB9of2JIw.review_text: Atmosphere was one of the more memorable stops on a recent impromptu Friday party-until-you-can't-pronounce-your-own-name night in SF.  In a 9  1/2 hour span I found myself at Grand Café, Press Club, Palio's, Giordano Bros, Rosewood, Atmosphere, and Sip.  At 2am I was on my knees in the bathroom at my friend's brand new Embarcadero bachelor pad claiming the "first ever to barf" prize.  And at 9am he woke to find a shopping cart in his living room and couldn't remember how it got there.  The long line outside Atmosphere is not a lie, it's equally as crowded inside.  The upscale feel is instantly lost or inadvertently ignored as your eyes are first drawn to the raised platforms with the dancing girls, and then to the mass of writhing bodies on the main dance floor.  Looking for the single 20s and 30s crowd?  This is your spot.  There are many pockets of seemingly single ladies here.  My friend quickly picked out an attractive girl in a group of three and started talking to her.  Shortly he came back to report that "her breath stank".  lol.  Lesson here is, always pack gum when you go drinking.  The bar is crowded but the bartenders are efficient, you'll get your turn to order within 5 minutes.  The alcohol was flowing as we took turns buying each other rounds of gin & tonic, raging bulls, and Grey Goose shots.  At some point the bartender, while pouring an order of Grey Goose shots for another group, slid me a shot glass and pours me a freebie.  I realized how messed up I was when I looked down at the clear liquid swirling in the shot glass and felt both happy and sad at the same time.  It was like Sweet Free Shot! ...but Ugh...I'm staring down the barrel of drink 12, or was it 13, or 14?  Nevertheless, to show my appreciation I downed it like a champ and melted back into the crowd.  Great vibe, great club, great times.

3Kh9GKnsuhD3jE1H2tG3ew.review_text: Went here with my friends on 10-31-09 on a guest list (since it's halloween, paid $10 to get in).  There are two dance floors(upstairs music was rap, downstairs music is popular, rock,etc).  I thought it was alright for what it is, obviously many entered with costumes.

jXEo83-Cm6SlgiCgFbF7KQ.review_text: Okay, this was a 2-3 star experience.  The venue itself has really sweet decor, it has a classy feel to it.  But that vibe didn't match the music, which on the Friday I went was 90s rap!   I happen to LOVE 90s rap so I was feelin myself but I can see that not really being everyone's scene.  It was easy to get drinks, the place never got too crowded, and of course it had good vibes.  Not my favorite club, but it's near this other wild place Sutra that was SUPERcrowded but also legit.    I'd say it's worth checking this place out but I might not count on it to be the destination for a whole night.

09oUMSRuD4nuwwgSO8YKJA.review_text: I've been to Atmosphere before, but this time around I reserved a VIP table for my cousin's bachelorette party. I have to give a shout out to KAREN, who runs the place. Thanks for helping us with our reservation & for taking good care of us.  The music was on point, the drinks were good & all the ladies had fun. The only downfall was that there was another VIP booth next to us full of guys (it was a bachelor party) & they kept bugging all of our ladies. Karen & her staff were kind enough to check in with us & to keep the crazy boys away.   We will be back!! Thanks again Karen!

l4P9wTSplP0WyJZvRh21xA.review_text: I haven't been to Atmosphere for a while but I used to go there all the time. From the sound of these other reviews, it's gone down hill.   I always had a great time at Atmosphere and never had any problems getting in. I guess it helps to know someone but even when he wasn't around, I could usually slide right in and not be harrassed by the bouncers or ticket girls. IT ALWAYS MAKES SENSE TO CHECK AHEAD FOR GUEST LISTS. Just a rule of thumb people, if you bitch about the cover or that it's too long a line, then you didn't do your homework!   I went to Atmosphere from the very opening, so I've seen them throw a good party but yes, from time to time the crowd will still be lame. Here's a tip: The later you go, the more crowded it will be but also the better the party vibe.   The front of the club is for lounging and for more low key chillin, thus the bartenders are also more low key. The back of the house is where the party's at. The bar is plenty big and they have plenty of bartenders so just keep it together or else pay for bottle service and shut up.   The DJs are mostly your run of the mill Top 40 guys/girls but there's plenty of room to dance and people watch. For some reason, this place attracts a lot of skeezy guys so, girls, watch your backs.   The bathrooms are nice and big and BONUS - they have a bathroom attendant. Don't forget to tip the attendant, they have to smell your shit all night!   Occasionally, there will be a big name roll thru for a short concert/appearance. So it's worth checking out the events.   Overall, I have never had a bad experience here, but maybe I'm blessed... Check it out, I'll be back soon!

bKmLqpm3ukBfOzETXpNSYA.review_text: It serves its purpose.  I come here to get ratchet.  That is all.

exgDi_lZjekOOtM1ZYedgA.review_text: had fun. got drunk. threw up in my friends car. major hangover the next day. missed a wedding. friends posted pictures of me kissing an ulgy girl on facebook. I was the butt of every joke all week. now im ready to go start over again.

RU8gjQ7i2OcGzKCN8hbeLA.review_text: Average DJ, leaving the booth quite often. Nobody was dancing before midnight. 2 different guestlists, 15 bucks after the so-called rebate. Next time I'll go to the Ruby Skye instead for the same price...

HYT8ETq0IoY4z_7OdgJ8Yg.review_text: Customer service is better then what it used to be when this place was called velvet lounge and 447. I don't go out as often as I used to but I came here last year in November and in April for bachelorette parties. Both times I had a blast. The bouncers weren't rude, the bartendar's were friendly and had a heavy hand with the drinks, which is always a plus and the rest of the staff there was just great. The music wasn't always the best during some parts of the night, but it's better then other places i've been to. Also the crowd wasn't rowdy like other clubs so I can't really complain about Atmosphere.  I'm glad I didn't experience the bad service that other people have mentioned here.  I guess it may just be a hit or miss for some folks. I'll be coming back to this place unless I experience what other patrons have gone through with the staff.

f1-Ds0X2Gb-acICN_oXVgw.review_text: Good venue to see Warren G on Halloween weekend. Other than a fight everything went smoothly. I bought tickets for the Halloween event online and had to wait almost an hour to get in, when doors had already been open over an hour. The place was pretty empty once we got in. I would come back on a regular night to update the stars.

kSXGl3NkPpc_SAk6yCOJIA.review_text: The first room is so tiny! and since it was a Friday they didn't have the loungey area open. The bigger dance floor opened later in the night which was nice. Come on mannnn spice it up!  -1 the crowd was okay. especially -1 for those guys who followed us the whole night. no thanks  -1 for the squishy first room where the bartenders aren't looking too thrilled to be there

eeO2tkfEtIrRVmD4TnVpFw.review_text: What atmosphere?!  Reasons why this place is not worth your time:  1. Horrible parking. 2. $20 cover. 3. Dance floor is covered in spilled drinks. 4. Bathrooms are filthy. 5. Creepers.

LlDS1Mdu-4pEyQTvBIgJyg.review_text: Specific gueslist girl - rude to my friends when their names weren't on her list. It's cool if your job is to only let people in who are on the list but don't be rude abt it, especially when there's no line outside! Guys @ door not nice either. Really? If I worked in the nightlife industry I would follow the general concept that MORE LOVE = MORE $$..guess we'll have to agree to disagree. 1 extra star club decor...

Elr7_s3ySqU3hfJCsY705w.review_text: Definitely one of the nicer venues in San Francisco - and in the Top 2 of the list down Broadway. We had gone in on a Thursday to check it out - dead. But it gave us a good chance to see the place for what it was. Great sound system upstairs that isn't overbearing with another spin table downstairs. One of the owners was nice to come chat with us on the slow night and offered us VIP passes to come back on a busier night. We took him up on the offer, and it was busier, but still slow. Great music though. Great bar and stage upstairs and a roomy dance floor. Nice mixed crowd. Has a lot of great potential. No website up yet so its pretty hard to get on a guestlist. Part of the drawback is probably cover. Will come check it out again in a couple of months once they're a little more established.

5re8RQ-2-Mkz7LC4ftYfHw.review_text: omfg never coming here again unless its a super super close friend's bday and they were NOT going to change their mind to go anywhere else.   When we found the place, i thought it looked pretty cool. There was a black velvet curtain shielding the actual club from the outside and where to pay cover so i had nO IDEA what was in store. the four of us came late so after we got our IDs checked, we walked up to the lady who was at the window to check VIP/cover. She was SO FUCKING RUDE.. She said cover for ladies is $10 and $20 for guys. Then my friend said POLITELY, "oh we're on VIP guestlist." Then she then looked at us up/down, scoffed and said, "Uh. You' guys are not on VIP," in a super fucking high maintenance bitch ass voice pretending she was princess of the fucking booth looking down at her peasants or some shit. NO COVER. the look on her face when she had to stamp  our wrists was TOO GOOD.  anyways, i flicked open the curtains. ..... OMG THANK GOD WE DIDNT PAY COVER. i would have been so mad if i had to. t5n5XdIHU5zaPu6VKmD4Sg.review_text: Attempted this club last night. Not my typical scene anymore but I wanted to check out the venue and the promos said they would be playing top 40 and hip hop, so I thought it might be cool. Located in north beach right by all the strip clubs so unfortunately while waiting in line you run into all the rift raft. Tons of cops in the area so for the females it does make you feel fairly safe. While waiting in line I did appreciate the employees checking in line for anyone on the guest list. We got stamped and didn't have to worry about running late. Downside of the line, it was cut into 3 different lines. Which could have been ran better. All lines were ran by 5 giant bouncers who decided to serve the line with the girls wearing the least amount of clothes. After waiting patiently we get searched and we go in. The place is packed, non danceable :( its a large venue and decorated elegantly. We make our way to the busy bar up stairs and attempt to order a drink but had no success. 4 bartenders, 3 all trying to figure out the register and 1 trying to serve. After getting skipped over one to many times we decide to head out. The music in this room was top 40 ten years ago so we thought there might be hip hop in the other room, I suppose Erykah Badu is hip hop enough for that crowd. Disappointed we all headed to a bar.

dWe_c1dQFmgyFjejMe7RDw.review_text: Used to be called Latitude, music wasnt that good, club was nice they remodeled it but nothing to spectacular..... They had a large room in the back that was nice and a small room in the front which was useless since the bar and entrance destroy the room's mood..... you cant really dance and smaller room next door is more like a lounge.... Other then the big room, cool crowd it was worth the $10 admission!

WeK_cyQULgbOPJtavcgtPw.review_text: We went here for a friend's birthday and got bottle service since they were having a special. Ironically, horrible atmosphere. It was a total taco fest...which is usually not a problem, but 75% of the girls were wearing jeans. Given, it was the weekend Jay-Z and Justin Timberlake were in town, but the place was EMPTY. Our party of 15 was probably half the club. The area for bottle service was in a corner and kinda ghetto. The hostess was super nice but it didn't overlook the fact that the club was NOT hoppin. DJ sucked and everyone had to be SUPER drunk to be dancing...  Some redeeming factors:  The staff was super helpful and weren't jerks when the birthday girl barfed. Bartenders were attentive and not discriminating like at Infusion. You get a free drink if you check-in on Yelp

8I9dnPQWpS8Y1srWJ4uMfQ.review_text: Not sure why only two stars, ended up here on a Friday night, I was totally under dressed. Next time I will pop on my spanx and spandex gurl!  100% Gutta

Me2oay0zfZ1gyrrWXDn2-A.review_text: Saturday night a few girlfriends and I went to Atmosphere.  We walked past two strip-clubs and a few other night clubs that all had a line and were amazed that we were able to walk right into Atmosphere.  Hum, not a good sign. But, figured we would give it a shot considering we got into the club for free. Right after we walked into the club, there was no-body there!  There were a few girls around the bar for a bachelorette party and a few horny guys that were on the prow-ell after leaving the strip clubs trying to get lucky! We stayed until almost midnight - way too long!  We were tired of staying around so we decided to leave so we could dance..  place was a bust..

3Qo52gcZo8_G7qx91BdV_w.review_text: Spacious--a lot of place for roaming around and dancing too Nice Staff- staff/crew/bartenders are very nice and helpful Price- affordable not pricey at all  -- they have 2 dance floors wd 2 differnt music which is so cool.. u can choose wc music u like better.  -- need to pay 20 to get in,,i dint have cash wd me BUT GOOD TNG they hay ATM insde d club so u dnt have to go anywer else --a lot of chairs to sit at. if ur tired dancing thhey hav big sofas for u to rest on --ambience is good, Cool dANCE FLoor and design modern looking, simply but classy --crowd is ok too =) -- there was a close pay parking in the bar, u just pay 10 for it. Sounds good rather than walking so far.

D-anvESbGXSH60T4AalPEg.review_text: This club was not as poppin as I expected. I went on a Friday night and expected it to be really fun, but it was extremely empty and the crowd was a little old/strange.  The bathrooms were really far from the entrance and right next to an empty dance floor. The design of the club is really strange in that it's awkwardly shaped. The DJs play at weird stations in the club. The music was whatever and we tried to request songs but the DJ ignored our requests. Rude.  Also, the drinks were mediocre and not strong. The only bright side was that the bartenders were speedy, but that could've been because it was such an empty night.  After having better experiences at other clubs in SF, Atmosphere ranks on the bottom of my list.

9yPITTB_nUpXkau8IqfPqQ.review_text: The venue itself is big enough for me to dance and has two rooms. I've only been here once and didn't like it at all probably because it was asian night by visionshock. I might give it another shot if there wasn't an event by asian promoters because I like diversity whenever I go to clubs.

eoVTW6VyUQ68Wq2EF4j2-A.review_text: Very fun place to go to around Broadway, which is right near Apartment 24, Sutra, Horizen etc.  What I like about this place is that there is parking around the corner that charge a flat rate of 20 bucks.  The night we went our friends and I did bottle service. We arrived around 10ish and the place was EMPTY! Seriously the first ones there! After meeting with the hosts they informed us the upstairs wasnt open yet to guest only VIP AND that the BOTTLES wouldnt be ready till after 11!!!! They encourged us to buy the drink special for that night.   Downstairs is nice. Open, nothing to fancy. I didnt get to check the other room which had a pool table. Upstairs was the place to be. Dj played top hits etc. The VIP area was nice and BIG!! 3 plush couches tons of chasers and a HOT hostess! A bad/good thing about the VIP area was you can only enter in with a wristband. The bouncer who was in charge of it didnt really care who came in or out!  Overall place is nice. Open dance area, great bartenders who worked fast.  If you plan on doing bottle service arrive after 11!!! Save you the hassle on waiting :)

_pIG1_s6Bzymn1zeyLjBHQ.review_text: We have a monthly "Drinks for a Cause" event at different venues throughout San Francisco.  A couple months ago, the venue was Atmosphere, a place I had never visited.  Being located in North Beach, I knew I'd have parking problems, but for a whopping $25, I was able to park across the street in the lot.  (If you saw my heels that night, you'd see how spending $25 was a simple decision.)  Hundreds of my friends were present on this night, which automatically makes for a fun evening.  Factor in an early evening from hell, I came ready to drink.  Well, the great music, the stiff drinks, the cool venue, and great friends made for an awesome night.  Bartenders were friendly, and the wait was never that long, even with a packed house.  The bouncers were friendly, and even the rain didn't dampen our spirits.  While I have not been here on a regular weekend evening and don't know what the normal clientele would be - I can only say that one this evening, Atmosphere was the ideal location for this event.  Did I have fun? You bet.  Can I recall how much fun? Not really....but I'm pretty sure it was a lot of fun.  Let's just put it this way. It was one of those rare nights where even I agreed - yep, I should be driven home, thereby being the recipient of a "drive Grace home" caravan.  Good times!

3f0Nk5y6C5f5_7VlsBjxdA.review_text: Not my first time here but the first time under the new name Atmosphere   Visited here a couple years back when it was velvet lounge and club 447. I visited Atmosphere on 07/04/10 for the fourth of July  and it was a nice size crowd for a Sunday night. First off It seem like there was no dress code but a dress code that called for baggy jeans, tennis shoes and fitted new era's. The club has two levels the lower section consist of a bar and  a pool table. The upper level consist of the dance floor which really wasn't spacious and cramped a nice size bar and like on V.I.P section. I love hip hop but It was whatever was played on KMEL ......  and didn't really change up from bay rap to a little of whats popular or older  songs from various artist.    So alright club but no dress code, cramped dance floor and crowd left something to be desired.

OAJoabfTubJL_11ho5TQeQ.review_text: So I've only been here a couple times, and it's only ever been just OK for me. I've never paid to get in, which is a big plus, and never waited in line really either. You can add yourself to the guest list online, and avoid all the BS.   The drinks are standard, not TOO strong, not weak. Average pricing for a club, which is steep already, in my opinion. The music is decent. The crowd is ehhhh. I've heard it's better on Saturday than Friday every time I've went (which always happens to be a Friday) and I've never actually stayed longer than an hour and a half or so.   It's a good place to be if you have a pretty big group because there is plenty of space. At least on Fridays.

9IcqLijhyYfYxhkFCpBykg.review_text: We came here with about 25 people on a Saturday night. We didn't have to worry about parking because we took a party bus here from San Jose. So granted, we all had a great time because we didn't have to worry about driving home.  There is a lot of space here, which is good. It gets super hot but the upper level definitely has more ventilation and space. I loved standing under the AC and dancing because it was so powerful and cooling.   $26 for 2 vodka tonics and an AMF. AMFs were small and not very good. The music was okay. A lot of R&B if you are into that music. I wish they played a little of top 40/house.   The crowd was primarily hispanics. I wouldn't say it was completely ghetto, but it kinda was lol. It was also fleet week and there were marines/sailors in uniform all over the place on Broadway - that was a pretty fun experience to see them all over the place.   I would come back here, but I wouldn't wait in the long line for it. The party bus allowed us to not wait in line and not have to pay for cover so that made up for everything.

5U7TL7snFYmyHuO59OYEpw.review_text: Our night at Atmosphere started with scoring free tickets for entry.  Things from there pretty much kept along this winning streak the entire night.  Drinks are within the usual SF club price ranges (~$8 average), but on the awesomely stiff side.  Patrons are your usual 20 to young-30's crowd, leaning towards Asian and Hispanic, with a sprinkling of everything else.  It can feel like a high school dance at times, with groups each doing their respective interpretive dance of circle jerking.  On the plus side, if you're pressed for entertainment, watch for drunk chicks spontaneously deciding to get up on the tiny "stage" and do whatever it takes to get some attention.  I'm wondering how Atmosphere has yet to bear witness to a big-boned attention whore snapping a heel and careening off stage onto some unfortunate SOB.  (Oh well, at least the victim's end would be relatively quick.)  The club venue itself pretty much opens up with a smaller dance floor and bar to the right, leading to a short flight of stairs to a larger dance floor.  The smaller dance floor gets really crowded, and the bar doesn't help; because there's no designated dance area, drunk dancers are prone to bumping into you and spilling drinks over everyone and their mother.    The larger dance floor has a bar to right, and restrooms in the back.  Honestly, Atmosphere could do without the restroom attendant...I feel weird that patrons are tipping a guy to stand there all night and suffer through the continuous sights, smells, and sounds of piss, vomit, and shit.

4eR6hYFJcBHoAqhuOS07ww.review_text: This place gets 4 stars for their HUGE dance floor. Easily, the biggest dance floor I've seen out of all the SF clubs I've gone to.   Venue itself is nice and sectioned off. The mirror is great; especially when you watch people run into them (just like multiple reviews said).   Music is great, the crowd was better looking than I realized. Maybe it was just the group I went with or the promotion company did a good job but this place is nice.  The only downside is how ridiculously HOT and STUFFY this place is. Had it not been for the huge dance floor, this easily would have gone down to a 3 just because it's got the worst ventilation system out of all the clubs I've gone to.   Other than that, good job Atomosphere.

JO9CPEwBjV3UJuIOgs8Zzw.review_text: My friends and I were lucky to find this place. We were originally gonna party it up at Bubble Lounge, but since it was a Thursday night, the crowd was old, like they just go off work, and the dance floor downstairs in the cave was closed so we left right away. One of my friends suggested we try Dragon Bar on Broadway, so we walked over just to find that it was closed! However, there was a line out the door for this place called Atmosphere that was right next door. We looked at it, contemplating whether or not to go, when these two asian promoters came up to us asking if we wanted in. We asked for the cover price and it was $20! EFF THAT. I used some smooth talking with promoter, saying we had nine girls, of course you can let us in for free and give our guys a break since we had so many girls. He offered us girls free admission and guys $10 each. Not too bad since we also got to skip the ridiculous line.  When we got inside, they just opened up the second floor dance floor and the music was poppin'!  Too bad I don't remember much of the night.....just more a reason to come back again to check it out :)  Final comments: Large dance floor with a great crowd and great music. Just try to get on the guestlist beforehand to hopefully escape the cover or go with a lot of girls.

RlquHGZ0v1uL2mqsD_vhVw.review_text: I went here this past Sat and had a blast. It was empty when we first arrived but it filled up quickly.   Parking: All bad. You can park in a lot for $20  Line: Getting in was easy. No line at 10:30  Dress code: Club attire. Most ladies had on the freak em dress with the heels, on the other hand I saw guys with tennis shoes on.  Cover: Get on the gl and arrive before 11:00  Bar: Great Service  Music: The music was good. Top 40/Hip hop  Crowd. Young and diverse  If your looking for a place to go out and have a good time, I would say Atmosphere is the place.

v10dHdqf42tUkxbYVnFW6w.review_text: This place is alright.  They played alright music when we went on a Tuesday night.  Alcohol seemed a little pricey for a Tuesday night at a bar, but then again they still had a DJ spinning and was in Broadway of SF, for $6 beers, $8-$10 shots, and $8-$10 mixed drinks is standard.  But I can imagine this place being highly overpacked and getting really hot, stuffy, and sweaty on Friday and Saturday nights since it's pretty small.  Had no more than 10 people on the dance floor when we were here.  No real dress code since they let us wear hats, shorts, sneakers, jerseys, etc. when we came in.

bH0ec25L7Yaladd2JyLRwg.review_text: I laughed watching how many people walked into the wall sized mirror on the first floor. Haha. The bathroom door is weird, kinda see through. Really wasn't feeling that as I pissed. People may not be able to see the color of my panties exactly, but they sure could see my body outline of my taking off my pants. Pervs!!   The down stairs is kinda cool, kinda weird. It's got a pool table, but I don't really know if people used it. And the DJ down here sucked. About an hour later they opened the upstairs, which was much better. The DJ spun well, and we were able to sit behind him. It was funny to see him kick people off the stage for dancing too hard or annoying him. I'm thankful he let us sit there though, I was suffering from a hangover from the night before so I wasn't drinking (I was the designated driver) and didn't feel like dancing much. Thanks DJ!! Oh plus, his GF was up there and she was really sweet talking to us. ;D

whMe0A03TtCq-ChP1XR1hQ.review_text: Can I choose NO stars? Guess not... I have to choose atleast one...BOOOO! Wow this place is the most ghetto club EVER! Just about 3-4 fights thats night, Looks like a empty warehouse, still had to wait in line when we came on a party bus, dudes with sunglasses on even though it is super dark, trashy girls, and guys that think they can just touch you as they walk by, not my scene that's all Ive got to say!

MxnNT3MSGco7hQN6-pCNow.review_text: I thought this club was pretty legit.  Broadway has so many places to choose from and to me they range from corny to hood.  Atmosphere happened to lean towards hood.   The music was great- there are two floor with different good music.  Saw tons of skanks shaking their behinds on guys like they were getting paid.  Hopefully those guys got lucky or else they'd be getting major major blue.... Huge second floor and plenty of space to dance- practically breakdance if you wanted to.  Ha.   Virtually no wait at the bar.  Only place to park around here are the lots for 20 bucks.   We showed up at the club close to 11pm and the line just went by- none of that holding you out in the dang cold when the club is actually empty.  Of course it was a dub to get in though- nothing out of the ordinary.   I know you can't smoke indoors Cali yet I smelled like smoke after? Interesting.   I'm down to come back here fo sho.  Its definitely way better than Sutra which is nice door. Ugh. Thinking about that place makes me want to throw up.

XxDPzTC-w1UucRUSoxW-bg.review_text: I like this club. Although I went on a slower night, which happened to be a Saturday, I was really feeling the music on both floors. The first floor started out as techno/house music and for a portion of the night turned into reggae. Sounds strange, but they made it work. The second floor was hiphop mainstream and some oldschool 90s R&B! I felt like it was all me. My friend wasn't feeling it tho, because our musical tastes are different. But whatever, I loved the music! I also really liked the decor. And in a way, it was good that the night was not so busy, because at least me and my friend were able to sit down in the lounge areas, which I assume are usually reserved for VIP. I think the drinks are a good price, not too expensive. One of the bartenders was cool, or should I say semi-bartender, because I did not really see him serve drinks, but more clear drinks off the table. He would start dancing on the dance floor, which is great, because I think bartenders or semi-bartenders should be able to mingle with the crowds on the dance floors for at least a lil bit. And hats off to Linda who was working in the girl's bathroom, because she is super sweet. I hope to come here again on a busier night to see what's up, because I really like this place.

dlqYxvxdAkJTqLqiMjb4Ug.review_text: So a group of us went here this past weekend for a celebration.  I'm not too familiar with the SF night scene since I was just visiting from SoCal, so I didnt really know what to expect from Atmosphere.  So here's the scoop.  Place is a relatively decent size.  We had a private table which is basically just a room off to the side with three spearte booths for each party.  There's a bar at the center right when you walk in and in the back is another bar with a pretty big dance floor.  Standing outside at first, I thought the place was pretty ghetto but I was with my group of friends so I guess that didnt really matter.  You get out what you make of it so.  Dance floor was pretty cool, they had good hip hop music.  Drinks, we table service so didnt really drink anything except Belvedere and OJ.  Our hostess wasnt all that great though.  All in all, it was ok.

k_6JJl12UTicAEt6Ji8yTw.review_text: the space is nice.. the smoking area sucks it is right next to a parking spot which is also nice but costly. i guess it really depends on the night you go...

jPhjJnQ2_3_-tu__KTQZlA.review_text: Bottle service was cheap!!!   We arrived at 11:30.  Half of our group had already came and got bottle service : two goose and two cognac for $ 750.00.  We finished that in no time!!   We walked around and scope out the second dance floor.  It's quite big.    Truthfully, I hated the place.  Its ghetto un-faboulous!!!  You're walking on spilled liquors everywhere.  Not my seen!!  I tried to drink but I was scared to get drunk there.  I didn't enjoy the music..    Lights on, Lets get out of here SafeLY!!

YAG90mceVFQLdvl4wndvQg.review_text: I came here for the NYE event. It was alright. The place wasn't too crowded so it was pretty easy to get to the open bar.   The crowd was diverse.   The music was okay. The first floor had late 90s music, while the second floor play music that was popular last year. I didn't hear to much of the top 40s on the radio now.  The theme was creation, but the decorations sucked and were serously lacking. They had two people dressed up as Adam and Eve, but they looked bored as hell. I don't even know why they bothered dancing on the stage. Also, they barely had any balloons to drop for the countdown.  The bathroom is too small. I had to wait more than 15 minutes to get a stall, which is always a mood kill.

0Cvgx6MKrSOTUxGoUpdaTg.review_text: A nice addition to Broadway.  I had a great time here last night for the soft opening.  This place had a nice feel to it...mabe cuz its still new. And they had the best staff ever....everyone was so nice.   2 bars and 3 rooms...one of them even had a fish tank in there....how often do you get that.  There was also a pool table inside.  There was a room that was very loungy.  I stayed upstairs the whole time....large dance area.  What I did love the most was the bar with the best bartenders ever.  Go there and check it out yourself...you'll know what I mean.  I'll be back for the grandopening.

xb_2s7A1QdV5-Gp4iK8lIA.review_text: OH MY WORD... probably the worst club ive ever gone to. I dont know if it was the night or whatever.. but the DJ was awful, the club was so dirty and it was so GHETTO!!!. I will NEVER ever go to this place or recommend this place to anyone. Hsi6oUKSG7H2xi47x0IHbA.review_text: Zebra Lounge... Club Latitude... and now... Atmosphere.... everything inside is still the same for the past 5 years i been promoting and coming here... they move thing around and change some of the interior but that was it... finally open that small little room on the other side, wow... always the same mixed crowd cause its broadway... ill come here if i have to, but if not forget it...

Mu_QSYuK4z0CbGuidWa_rA.review_text: I came here on a Sunday night because it was my friend's birthday and she got bottle service. I know, on a Sunday. But it was cool. The dj was playing oldie' and the venue was really nice.   The star ratings are mainly for the awesome security at this place. Some loser thought he'd be cute and dance up on me, pushing me into my friend at the process, so I shoved him away. A few minutes later, the same boor came up to get some more. When I turned back around to put him in check, a security guy asked me "you know him???" I shook my head and they escorted him out! Loved it. I'm so glad they were on it at this place. Props.

wsIh1q5zS7g-FIh8KuMDCg.review_text: I went here as part of a Party Bus that I arranged for my fiancee and my friends on 3/21/09.  The layout was nice with the the first level more of a lounge with a smaller dance floor and the second floor with a larger dance floor, vip areas and its own bar. I honestly don't remember exploring the first floor at all because I was really faded.  My group made our way upstairs (this was around 10pm when we got in) to hit up the bar that wasn't being used. The security dude kicked us out saying that the upstairs would be open in 10 minutes. Minus half a star since we were buying drinks, but I guess I could understand that they want the first floor to fill up.  I was already faded by the time I got in so I didn't need a drink anways, so I can't rate them on their drinks. What I could say is that the crowd was good, pretty chill, my friends were dancing with random girls, I think I was dancing with a random girl while waiting around the bar, and everyone was dressed decently.  None of the people in my group got kicked out, so that's a plus and I didn't feel like a sardine, big plus! I wouldn't mind going back again.

ROOSX6Gsi9t5pUAbfZtGTg.review_text: Rachett. Showed up here with 1 hour left only to see a fight happening. there was a singing Jerimiah event july 20, 2013. they need new securities. they did nothing but push the people fighting towards the crowd and not towards the exit.
