u9zqrRSnf6BByCIQ0MIyiA.review_text: First time going out in S.F. and ended up here for a friend's birthday. It looked cool at first, you know waiting in line and it looks like there's a whole lot of people because it was near 11 (we were on guest list). As we went inside though, hella empty! We assumed it was still early but the place was still pretty empty for the remainder of the night.   It was a nice place -- two stories, hella spacious and drinks weren't too bad. The bummer is that it would have been better if the whole place was filled up with people. The whole bottom floor was empty besides when people wanted to order drinks, because the bar's located on the first floor.   I guess the place to be was upstairs because by the end of the night it seemed pretty packed. So much ghetto-ness (not that it's a bad thing) going on on the dance floor though. Then there were gogo dancers and when they were done, random girls started dancing up there. As for music, there were a handful of songs that you just couldn't dance too, like rock music for example, so that was lame.   FYI: Hella creepers!! They are on the prowl! Once your man or friend, or partner leaves you alone for a second, they are right next to you like glue SO BEWARE!

r-8eQ28RhnQPJdZXHcTXrw.review_text: I've been here since it was Zebra Lounge.  It's one of the better spots in North Beach; you get a good amount of dance floor space, music was top 40, and crowd was fun.  I would never think of throwing my birthday here (nor my friends, I'd imagine) but I wouldn't mind coming here.

j9kOPJMoQsrHoYuQvD2ydA.review_text: It was Thursday. I overslept, and missed the cutoff for the guestlist (11pm). Already didn't want to go to begin with, definitely don't want to go now ($20 cover). I get in the shower to wake up, but was merely watering my sack of flesh of a body. Still feel like crap. Eff it I'm not going. "Where are you!?!?" "in the shower." "Whaaat?" But my friends are persuasive people...2 separate offers to pay my cover and buy me a drink, wait for me and share a taxi...the only thing that could've beat that offer is if they just came over and finished bathing and dressing me too. Fine ok, cold shower it is.  We roll up, hop out of the cab and into the line of 10 people. The harbinger of the night was lying in a puddle of his own puke in the alley. His buddy next to him on the phone doing a bad job of babysitting. We get in, it looks like what I remember, dark. It wasn't too crowded but decent. I go find the rest of my friends and they all have that glazed twinkle in their eye and start oversmiling and slurring at me. Apparently not only did we miss the free cover, but an open bar too. Say whaat? It probably was a good thing because from what I hear it was a barf fest about an hour later outside: one of said friends got kicked out and started puking on the sidewalk. Then soon after, a group of girls joined him and started puking together in unison. Think: Bellagio fountains.  As I hit the dance floor, I get shoved and spill some of my drink because the security guards are all rushing somewhere. I run toward the action and see some girls getting escorted out. Apparently a fight in the bathroom. Eh, back to dancing. Talking to my friend, and some drunk-ass knocks my jack & coke so that it splashes all over my friend's white shirt. Oh my god, it's not my fault!! It's cool, he's too drunk to be angry. Alcoholism isn't always bad.  I had a surprisingly good time. I know it was a fluke because of the open bar but I like when crazy ish happens. Shit-faced people make me laugh. There were also a lot of bored-looking Hasians in really short skirts dancing with each other but constantly looking around the room for the guy with the most expensive rice rocket to approach. And also a lot of dudes standing on the sidelines not dancing and  creepily watching the wannabe strippers that are dancing on that mini-stage near the wall. There were a handful of wrist grabbers who can't take a hint, and the obligatory group of amateur breakdancers who never dance with chicks. My favorite is watching the mounters attach themselves to my unsuspecting girlfriends and watch them get bucked off. Poor guys. Also, I am often victim to the ghost dancer who apparently had been dancing with me for the past 10 minutes but I had no idea because he managed to dance right up on me without ever touching me. So basically this place is a typical club but thank you for the open bar and good time.   P.S. Don't be a cheap-ass just because it's an open bar. Tip well. The bartender told my friends that they were the only people who treated him well so he hooked them up.

RKBS7RXOy_qUOfaqpfaJgQ.review_text: I went to this place for New Years Eve and my bad experience with this club started right off the bat. I was part of a large party that had a 20 person bottle service table for the evening. My experience in line was pretty terrible as the bouncers were extremely rude. One of my friends was not part of our table, but bought a normal open bar ticket. I explained to one of the bouncers at the front the situation and asked if she could come in with us and skip the line because she was with us. We were told to go to another person to get her wristband and then come to the front. While doing this, another bouncer came over to me and yelled at me to get in line or get lost and threatened to take my wristband away if he saw me again. This was completely uncalled for, especially since I was doing exactly what I was told by another bouncer.  Now if your party spends A LOT of money to get a bottle service table, you would expect to be able to use your table for normal table things at a nightclub. This club would not let anyone else to our table that was not part of our party. So if you met someone else at the club and wanted to invite them back to your table for a drink, you couldn't. That is absolutely absurd.  Also, the floor around our table was SO slippery that 3 people slipped and fell really badly.  The only reason I give this place 2 stars is because the waitresses for our table were extremely nice and friendly. They took great care of us and I just wish the rest of their staff showed us the same hospitality.  Overall, I would not recommend anyone getting bottle service at this club let alone pay a pricy cover to get in here. There are much better clubs in the area than this.

KmqivnDXe3mVjBtp9ZxkOQ.review_text: i forgot what it used to be called....but what ever it is now...its just not the same. I am not sure what was going on but i really disliked the fact that all the dumb hoes in the vip area thought they had to run into you every chance they got!!! i mean really come on im standing right here!!! walk around or let me know your comming by. dont just push me out the way. after the 5th chick i was ready to throw bows at the next person to walk into me. well it gets better...i wasnt feeling so good to begin with so i sat down by the stage. these two chicks kept getting closer and closer until they were standing over me... well at that point i had to say something...but the night gets better..... some random ass dude rubbed my head!!!!! wtf!!!!! i really dont want to go back there again... i probly wont unless i have to.

GYpdQjS_DjTk3Bj3GIr5JQ.review_text: Let's see here.. Long lines that lead to an empty inside. Trash people all around while you're in line. Lots of water and no fish in the tank.. Good times indeed, but not next time for me. Thank you very much.

vpYqTimouShq3Un90DUsIQ.review_text: I was in town for a case competition with other master's and PhD students, and Atmosphere was somehow chosen as he location for the afterparty. The place itself is nice, good location, but the people were SO TRASHY AND GHETTO!!!! After they opened it up to the public at midnight or so at LEAST six people from our event (myself included) had their phones stolen. And these are just the ones I have heard of. aw973Pm1nrTbRjP4zY9B9g.review_text: ATMOS ... first time here and you didnt seem to disappoint... for long!   The service was awesome. Of course no cover charge so that was a plus! Well, got in and it was so empty in there they were just holding the line plus it was still early i suppose. The bar was small downstairs and the upstairs dance floor was huge but they closed it off because it was "early" so only the bathrooms had access there.   Drinks are decently priced with a $10 min credit card charge, so not bad at all.   After around 11:15 the crowd started forming and they finally opened up the place and people migrated. The DJ was pretty good spinning top 40 and a few other slappers, but the crowd was just alright.   Towards the end of the night tho, damn it got GHETTO up in there. all this dudes tryin' to "function" and broads whippin their hair all over the place tho. NOT crackin. EOx4c3O1XeGEFVO0i1a2lQ.review_text: The place is surprisingly larger than it seems.  Very much on par with the rest of the clubs on Broadway.  The reason for my 4 stars is the service.  A friend in my group left her jacket there.  I called a day later and someone actually picked up and was nice enough to get the description and my number to call me back.  That's better than the "f*ck off" message I would expect from other places.

dMO2zgJFUT9oVbzR8nsr_A.review_text: This is a nice club. There's plenty of room but the restroom is like a mile away in the back of the club...lol. Music is good, the place is actually pretty nice. I think their VIP table area need to be bigger. It's a great place to hang out and chill at but the dance floor is also great. I actually really liked this place except for the bartender. They seem annoyed. If it wasn't for them, I'd give this place a 5 star.

CyBqMzCB42fVNynBKmZ7dg.review_text: This place is garbage the service is horrible they charged $125.00 for ultimate vodka so they said .......? but then actually charged my brothers card $185.00 not one time did the girl come to check on the VIP service or to refill our mixers the floors were soaked nobody there to clean up spills overall worst service ever and my sister in laws clutch purse was stolen !!!!! I would never recommend this club for VIP or anything ever they should burn it down !!!!!!!!!!!

_UXWlGpGI8QeDUZMyjP3jw.review_text: Don't let the pictures fool you. It nothing like it. Came here the past Friday night on a party bus. I expected this place to be popping when I got there because of they made us wait in line. To my disappointment, the club was pretty empty when we got in. =[  Slowly more and more people showed up. They had large mirrors and pillars inside and even in the dark it looked dirty. The mirrors had finger prints all over it and  the pillars had gum on it. Pretty disgusting.   FYI: the hallway to the restroom had used paper towel that no one bothered to pick up which gave made the place look even more dirty and gave it a cheap feel. The restroom looked like one of those dark scary public restrooms. Low light, metal heavy doors, dark painted walls.... feel like a scary story itself...  Don't think I'm ever going to come back here.

49iE9pwwkIBgQQHJsgDKiA.review_text: On a Saturday night at 10:45, they held a line outside while the place was relatively empty inside, also they charged $20 cover - way overpriced for the "atmosphere" inside.  The drinks were on the strong side, which was fine - by 11:30, we'd moved on to a different club.

QbNsDgq4vNBTbAUpJj7-Tw.review_text: This place didn't seem as bad to me as mentioned by the reviewers below, however it has been over a year since going to this club. From my experience, it has been pretty chill.   I've had photography gigs for the promoter around this time last year; for the most part, it was a cool environment i.e. people, music, setting. I remember losing my flash diffuser for my camera, and coming back to ask one of the bouncers, and he had recovered it, stored it, and gave it back to me, which I thought was rather nice. Inside, there is a huge fish tank which featured the elegant fish from Deuce Bigalow: Male Gigolo. I've only experienced the bottom floor subdivided into two areas. There's a pool table. Smell? All I smell is Atmosphere.   DJ plays Vintage Hip Hop & R&B, Rock, Electro with club anthem mashups & remixes.  I've met the regular DJ's, bartenders, security and I believe one of the owners- they were all cool.   I would though like to make it clear that I primarily came to the venue for the Tuesday - no cover promotion. Only a couple times I went on Fri/Sat and this place would get jammed-packed. I don't recall any negative experience other than jammed-packed.

TSdV_lsddT4F3TJvmdmXag.review_text: No, wannabe pickup artist, you cannot have the flower in my hair, and you are not cuter than me.  Even if you were - which I'm willing to concede if it's true - I am rather attached to my accessories, and no amount of harrassment around the dance floor is going to charm or annoy me into giving it up.  Pun fully intended.  So that's the crowd.  Proceed at your own risk.  Or maybe you like that sort of thing.  Not that there's anything wrong with that.  I came here last night for the Barrister's Ball - aka Law School Prom - despite reservations about North Beach in general.  (Go for the food, run like hell when the popped collars come out.)    Outside: you walk past a lot of skeevy strip joints.    Inside: the space is really pretty.  Very modern brick-and-metal decor.  Two levels and three main rooms.  Coat check.  There's only one bathroom on the first floor, which was closed for most of the night.  Upstairs, there's a bigger bathroom, with a bathroom attendant...and the general consensus was that bathroom attendants are: a) unnecessary b) uncomfortable c) did I mention unnecessary?  I'm a modern girl, I can dispense my own soap, find my own empty stall, and pick up my own towel.    Bar itself: Any bar without beer on tap is an automatic meh.  And wine is $8.  Ouch.  Music: standard 80's/pop/hip hop mix.  It was a great venue for barrister's ball, but once they started opening up the club to the general public, it became the guido-populated dance club of my nightmares.  If you're anything like me, go for private events only.  It was a fun night, but I was perfectly happy to leave after 11, and I don't think I'll go back.  Just not my scene...

nx10o8SCYiTn8KWhmM6l-w.review_text: Went here for one of those "Drink for a Cause" benefits... The music was pretty loud, so when I ordered my drink, the bartender messed it up completely. How do you get a vodka redbull from an order of vodka soda... uh... I didn't even bother to correct him for fear of getting a worse drink. Although the drinks were stiff, it was hard to chat w/ people due to how loud the music was. Oh well... At least it was for a good cause... Next Cause please...

TS1743yx60gkKZKumGgCsg.review_text: Didn't like the atmosphere much at Atmosphere.   There are 2 dance floors (actually "dance" floors). The first one isn't really a dance floor...it's more like a small open area where people cluster and groups of random drunk people dance. The second one IS actually a dance floor and it's a lot bigger. It got really hot, literally. The music was top 40, which was cool.  Super ghetto crowd with lots of creepy people. Yug.   The drinks were OK and the bartenders were OK. I found the bouncers to be kind of mean and the coat check lady wasn't very helpful either. Maybe it was just a bad night...I don't know.  The bathroom had some lady inside who was supposed to hand out towels (I guess?!), but she wasn't doing crap. She basically just stood there while other girls would cut in line or push their way into the stalls to throw up. She actually scolded me for standing too long at the sink to wash my hands and check my make-up :P  cover is $20 if you're not on the guest list. I would NEVER pay $20 to come here.

3qSYU0qVt8eym2FVb4Iagg.review_text: Ok so this is a tough one for me. I have been here a few times. I always have fun. Once was for Drakes afterparty,  Once was to see Lloyd (the R&B singer preform). and once for a friends bday. well........One time I went i was livid because the flippin lady bartender on the first floor jipped me out of my change. I gave her a 10 she never came back. i beleive I got a beer which was 6 dollars. NO heffer I was NOT leaving you a 4 dollar tip for your horrible service. I tried to argue calmly with her but she shrugged her shoulders and walked off. Anyways, THEN at the Lloyd party, I got attacked by a photographer who was hitting girls hands and shoving them out of the way to get a good shot. When the security came I tried to explain (once AGAIN calmly) why everyone was mad at him and he told me to shut the fuck up. hmmmmmmmm. THEN this HUGE avatar woman wanted to FIGHT me because i wouldnt, COULDNT move out of the way for her. it was chaos that night. the crowd was gutter trash that night.  But I will admit that one time ive been the crowd was pleasantly mixed. anyways it all goes back to it all depends on whos promoting.......i suppose.  I always end up going back there. its not bad ALL the time ;)

tIRh_AmxJhUgzoHUBMPnlA.review_text: I must admit when I rcvd an invitation to check out a new club I was pretty excited. Then get to find out it was my old hang out place, 5 years ago. The now "Atmophere" aka Zebra Lounge.  It was pretty much the same except when you walked inside, on your right there's a tiny room. Brings back old memories both good and bad. It's bit puzzling when bartenders (downstairs vs upstairs) charges differently for the same order (chilled grey goose & pineapple back)...hhmmm  Before I forget, Atmosphere have the cutest bartender. He's tall, know's how to make drinks just right, he might be half caucasian/half white. Didn't get a chance to get his name coz we headed to another club. Maybe next time...*wink*

6GnaCPahDqFOfiw1dtW9Xg.review_text: Love this place. Always have a great time when I go up! Have had some cool performers too!

011145MPIsSoYleZh6z0ug.review_text: DEAD AS SHIT. What the fk happened?!?!? this place used to be really fun but LITERALLY there was only my group of 8 people and some random old creepers at the downstairs bar tonight (FRIDAY fking NIGHT!!!!)   The dance floor that used to be popping was 100% EMPTY. Atmosphere is def not the ratchet fun it used to be.   R I P THEY JUST KILLED THE CLUB .

PSJ9LP_U3jF5K9avjvPPRw.review_text: This is the former Chinese video game arcade plus pool hall spot during the 80's and 90's. The club has its ups and downs, where there's nothing that stands out yet nothing that's completely terrible neither.   The layout is nice, as there's 2 levels of entertainment, plus we had a private party, so we were roped off from the general crowd, thus no need to battle with others for drinks or dance floor space.  Overall, I don't mind this place, yet I can understand other reviewers issues of space, relations with the staff, or other concerns. If my friends would like to return here, I wouldn't mind.

qD7BCSxI74WxmLmEHnwNPw.review_text: Had a similarly unpleasant experience as Quinn S.  We were on the guest list and were told the same thing: free Patron and free entry before 11.  We were made to wait in line outside for *one hour* despite getting there early.   Half an hour into it, a staff member wearing orange made the announcement to the line that they had now decided to start charging $10 for admission.  Some people left on principle, understandably miffed at being lied to, and others stayed... we decided to stay.  After an hour, we were finally allowed in, only to discover that we were waiting this whole time for a mostly empty venue (unsurprisingly  -- we'd all been to places like this before).  The bouncer ushered us toward the cash taker: "that'll be $15".  Confused, we explained that a guy outside in an orange shirt said the revised cover would be $10, not $15.  We were told smugly by the bouncer that "there is no guy in orange".  Eventually the staff conceded that he exists, but he was "misinformed".  The $15 fee stood, however.  I gave the cash taker a $20-bill... no change.  So I asked for my change, and after she made some suspect eye-contact with the bouncer, she reluctantly gave me the $5 she owed me.  To summarize, free cover and free Patron turned into $10 cover with no free Patron, which turned into $15, which nearly became $20... an hour later.  Each step of the way we were a little more invested, so it wasn't worth it for us to turn away, which is why we stayed.  A primitive strategy that can make you a lot of money for an event, but ultimately a bad idea if you're at all interested in return business, good reviews, or have any ethics whatsoever.  Without getting into specifics (I don't want to be a dick), the dancers on the second floor leave *a lot* to be desired.  I was a bit embarrassed for them.  The upside: drinks were decently strong, and service at the bar was pretty quick (the latter of which you can chalk up to an empty venue).  Overall I strongly recommend against Atmosphere.

FpOste6Fh4ppO7jol-JlQw.review_text: Parking in North Beach is a BITCH so my friend and I missed the guestlist :( Cover was freaking $25! I was pretty pissed so I went to go drown my sorrows at the bar with a $10 shot of patron (which was actually really bigger than an average shot). It must have been 11:20pm or something and the dance floor was DEAD! Weird, but the people we met up with seem to get the party started. Oh and so random! It became a concert with some rappers? and throwing out free t-shirts that were 5 sizes too big? I did like the top 40 music, though the mixing wasn't perfect.

WU63-7JLQgpR8y4OeQnYRA.review_text: We just sorta wandered in off the streets after dinner one Friday night.  All the big guys with clipboards and ear pieces at the front door were super friendly, smiling and trying to get us to come in.  So we moseyed on over the the line, and a few minutes later, someone asked us which guest list we were on.  I look at him like "What guest list?"  So he goes off and comes back with a manager, who proceeds to give the girls stamps to get in for free, and drink tickets for champagne.  Awesome!  He, like everyone else we encountered, was also incredibly friendly, chatting everyone up as he went.  And we didn't even have to be a skanky girl-only group in order to get such special treatment.  I'd go back just for the smiles.

G5msygFjJeciNrQEu1wjsg.review_text: I usually don't write reviews and I am not sure if it is fair to write this review. But I have to. We were put on a guest list and we got there at least half an hour before. We waited on a line that hardly moved and after the clock hit 11, guess what, the line started to move and the guest list was invalid and they asked us to pay if we want to get in. Who do they think we are, stupid?  I would have gladly paid the required amount if I was told that the guest list was not accepted that night. To me it is about principle and I will never go to that place again.  I am not sure if it is the owner's fault or the stupid promoter or manager. If it is the owner's policy, I think it is a bad policy and I think that is not the way one runs a business. If it is a promoter or a manager fault, the owner should take action to fix the problem.  Just my humble opinion after waiting in the cold for half an hour.

E9TBe7OJ4LYQnwAh4PhJIg.review_text: We received bottle service last Saturday for my friends bachelor party. Karen did a great job setting everything up and informed all the proper people if our plans. Our hostess was great and went out of her way to make sure we were all comfortable and and that we all had a great time. I would highly recommend them for bottle service and their great deals with great service.

evnyfXDWW39FI3NUYU1fFQ.review_text: Now this is what I call a club! Of the clubs ive been to in the bay, this prolly comes the closest to what im used to when i went clubbing back in the days.   Came here on a sat night with the roomies. Good, comparably diverse crowd, good music, drinks aren't too expensive, huge dance floor upstairs and it was packed! I also enjoyed watching ppl dance on the "stage". Reminds me of my old clubbing days...ahhh  Def on my list of clubs to go when you are looking for a good night!

DEa615IKMclHk5UbsUK3tQ.review_text: This place is ratchet to the max!!! I don't go out clubbing much anymore but I used to frequent this place back when I was in my early 20s! Thank goodness my friend's friend had a bottle service table!!! I stayed there! Away from all the ratchetness! I'm glad I didn't drown in the sea of boys scouting vulnerable girls, girls wearing "long t-shirts" that are too small for them, and sloppy dancing.  No classiness at all! But I will give Atmosphere 2 stars for making the place pretty with lights and fancy chandeliers!   Yelp also had a check-in offer of a Sailor Jerry Cocktail! It's nothing special! It's just Rum&Coke!

nnImk681KaRqUVHlSfZjGQ.review_text: Came here during Spring Break. A really good experience. Didn't have to deal with the line or a high cover thanks to the guestlist. The club is spacious, the dim lighting in the first room makes it very chill, a cool place to relax with your friends and have a good time. The bar on the first room also is not as packed and service was quick and drinks were good. The second room has the huge dance floor with music videos playing and it was probably one of the nicer clubs I have been to during my stay in California and clubbing in general. The crowd with mixed with many different groups of people, which was nice to see. The DJs were pretty good, playing some music I could dance to though a few songs were obscure to me being an out-of-towner.   A really fun and chill and upscale place to go with your friends for a fun night in the city.

220NBEU9WyTrI077MPPlJg.review_text: Damn, Atmosphere. Your name is so very misleading. Atmosphere/A3 conjures up scenes of a club on the top floor of a tall building. The club walls consist mainly of windows, giving party-ers an amazing view of the city lit up in the night. Instead you are just a (slightly) 2-story club in the middle of North Beach with one window on the 2nd floor. It failed to give me an atmospheric feeling.  Got in, headed straight to the bar on the second floor, got drinks (they were pretty darn strong), walked to the dance floor, decided I needed more drinks, walked back to the dance floor, and boogied.   Yay for spacious dance floors, a chill first level floor with seating (for girls in painful heels to rest), a large bar, and decent music. Boo for stopping the music and kicking everyone out at 1:30am. Brings back (lame) memories of clubbing in Downtown SD during the college years. Also, I would not pay $20 for this place. It's nice, but not $20 nice.   I'm so ready for Vegas!

FkYsJ8HFaGY7w1mMb1TZQA.review_text: Very nicely renovated lounge/club which a diverse selection of music for every crowd!  Owners and bar staff are very helpful and accommodating.  Had bottle service and there is always one attendant to make sure you are getting everything you need and having fun! Parking sucks but thats broadway for ya.

kie7nzDJYisVYHGWBS373Q.review_text: If you're a San Franciscan, then you've probably been to a good number of clubs; and the venue at Atmosphere has probably been part of your journeys at some part of your clubbing career.  I like the layout with some of the tables. It's akin to being just far enough from the crowd, instead of being blasted by flying drinks.   Though, with any club here: you can't dance when there isn't enough room to avoid touching someone's butt, and wading through the crowd to find a spot is futile. Even though the dance floor is pretty big, you're not likely to avoid a drink down your back.  I've never had a stellar experience here, but I've never had a bad one either.

ZMBIjbnvatw6Z6JNPlS99Q.review_text: Not a bad club for something outside of Vegas. I would say that it is better than some of the ones I've been to in LA even. Except the men are a little more well behaved here. Which is a good thing!  The wait was a a bit annoying, but not too much so. Drinks were ok, not very strong though. The music was decent. The loungy section was pretty cool. Overall not bad for a SF club. My best experience in norcal as of yet.

aVXjYtQbRiHBgffcoHtyOw.review_text: If I could I would give this place ZERO stars. I read reviews about the staff/security being absolute garbage and boy are they right. Honestly, who the hell would hire the staff there..or better yet how the hell can those people have jobs? I wouldn't even hire them if they would work for free!   Long story short...last stop on the party bus was Atmosphere (worst idea ever)....got there and they wouldn't let us in unless we bought a bottle...we agreed to purchase one even though we didn't have to because we came from the party bus...dumb bitch at the door switched it up and said oh actually you have to buy two bottles if you all wanna get in...While we were dealing with that dumb ass broad the bouncers were sitting  talking shit to my whole party.... So we told her and all the staff to f*** off...walked across the street to Horizon and spent over a grand there....YOUR LOSS ATMOSPHERE! (heard there was barely five ppl in there last night anyways!)  I will never ever in my life step foot in your shitty club with even shittier STAFF!

4RWjr6-QXA9Z-7gRMXMDhQ.review_text: Drinks are nothing special. I liked that the place was large...if i remember correctly, they had 2 rooms and bars downstairs and a large dance floor and bar upstairs. Drinks were not too hard to get. But over all nothing special. Prolly wouldn't come back. The girls dancing on the mini stage upstairs was nice tho.

KxRf-umHzdz5noKH5Cg6Mg.review_text: We were on the guestlist and got here before 10:30 and the line barely moved, but we made it in right before 11:00 so we only had to pay $10.  Would have been nicer to have gotten in for free, though!    Upstairs in the main room they played hip hop.  Some slow beats at times, but good songs nonetheless.  I wouldn't say it was overly crowded in there.  However, having people constantly walk by no matter where you were on the dance floor was seriously annoying!  Maybe it had to do with the layout of the place, but still, not fun getting bumped into constantly.  And there were hands all over as people walked by.  Did you really need to walk on by?  Or was that just an excuse to cop a feel here and there?!  And not just the guys but the girls!  I even had a girl get all touchy-feely!    I preferred the downstairs room where they were playing a mix of hip hop, R&B, and top 40.  Not as many people dancing in there but plenty of space for me to get my groove on, and that's all I need!  I didn't go into the room with the fish tank but watch out people, the entrance to the room is over to your left.  A few more feet to the right and you'll walk into a mirror!    A couple stars knocked off for the crowdedness and all the "walking not dancing" people in the main room upstairs, so 3 stars for the good music and my own personal dancefloor in the downstairs room!

eNX6YE8lw8rVczBOFU6P6Q.review_text: Best nights are when someone is performing, be sure to get here early to avoid the line. The owners are very nice and helpful, bottle service is fast and nicely done. The renovation has definitely "one-up" the place, especially in comparison to its surrounding competition. Security is strict but on-point. Last my not least, they serve Coconut Ciroc here!!!!

Ta4UF_SopGtDWE4mg9E2_g.review_text: From out of town.  I've only been to a few SF clubs.  One of em being the one next door, Sutra.  We went on Friday night.  Sutra let us in for free at 10:45pm.  There were probably 15 people max in there.  No re-entry.  We left at 11pm to find a 20 ppl line next door at Atmosphere.  We waited.   Atmosphere charged me 20$ to get in and my girlfriend 10$.  Outrageous.  But whatever, we're on vacation.   There's 2 sections.  The front section that you first run into was fairly bare by that time, 11:30 ish.  The back was pretty full.    The club was pretty fun.  Pretty good blend of people and we ended up having a good time.    This isn't an 'Asian Invasion' club like Sutra was.  At least this night wasn't.  The music was decent, no real complaints.   I'd probably come here again, but I'd try my best to get on that damn list.  30$ for 2 people was ridiculous...

0c1KQRT-lyWEyHumLwuQHQ.review_text: On Saturday Nov/8/2014 I booked a bottle service for a party of 18 to celebrate my 30th birthday.  We arrived in a party bus and Karen the lady who took care of my reservations said we would be ok and we wouldn't have to stand in the long line. When we arrived the security at Atmosphere said we couldn't be dropped off there even though I told him we had bottle reservations.  Karen the lady who handled my reservation wasn't even there, I had to wait for another hostess to come out and we still had to stand in the long line outside the club. Finally when we were escorted in, the hostess had to ask a group that was already seated in our booth to leave. There was only 16 of us but I paid for 18 people instead. We had to wait 10mins for our bottles, and I ordered the Champagne and Belvedere special but she didn't bring out the champagne. We also ordered beers and she never brought them. She just brought our 2 bottles and mixers and never returned with my order of 3 buckets of beer or the champagne. I had to go to the bar to go get the beers. The whole night she never came back to check on us to ask if we wanted anything else or a refill on the mixers. I contacted Karen the lady that handled my reservation and she never responded. It's ridiculous that I over paid them and I never received any VIP service at all. We left the club and there was still drinks at our table. My friends and I were hoping to have a good time especially since they had Mase at the club that night performing. It was ridiculously pathetic!! I spent over $700 for bottle service and it wasn't worth it at all. What a total rip off!!  Since they knew the club was going to be crowded they should have been prepared for the crowd and be sure that the vip area received the service they paid for. I chose Atmosphere because the last time I went there with friends they were very good, but after last Saturday I am going to tell my other friends about how pathetic their service was. Karen could at least reply to my message or give me some kind of credit. I haven't heard from her or anyone else at Atmosphere.

gVEye2LuFCLxxFRc41jIKA.review_text: I came here with a party bus on a saturday night, we were given wrist bands, but there was some confusion and the bouncer made us line up outside for 10-15 minutes. Finally someone told the promoter that we were from the party bus and we were let in. Doh. We had bottle service and the waitresses were really fast with refilling juice and getting us more cups. Our group had over 25 people and we went through a lot of the stuff but the waitresses kept up. The bathroom was sufficient, relatively clean and the wait was acceptable.

9eRr2tVQ84F4B3IiYzgIxQ.review_text: It's was super fun I had a blast thank yu so much Karen for making my boyfriends birthday fun thank u

V4yqq3Lu7_ONT0XnPXiJ3Q.review_text: Grand Opening 10/17/08.  From what I hear, its going to be cool.

OPoUR6nKMow0Wk23emHPew.review_text: I went here this weekend with a couple of my friends and there were things i liked/disliked about this place.   likes- 1) different music on the 1st and 2nd floor; there was hip hop/r&b on the second floor and at times-- some house music on the first.  2) the bartender hooked it up with some loaded patron shots :):)   dislikes- 1) this was a SUPER asian crowd and its soooo stuffy. literally, no air circulation on the second floor. 2) kindof reminds me of a 18+club b/c of the "atmosphere".. haha ;)   But overall, I like to go pick and choose my places for 'hangout' and this place wasn't as good as thought it would be..

qK5GQYyckJx_5tyqDtqrXw.review_text: We went here on a Saturday night for my friend's birthday celebration! They have a guestlist, and it's free before 11:00PM! Can't complain about that.   I probably wouldn't pay to get into this club though. My first time in Atmosphere and it's also probably my last UNLESS I HAVE to go for another friend's birthday.  We got there around 10:30 and the line moved fast, unlike some clubs in SF that holds the line. It was still pretty empty around that time. The place is huge inside. the bar downstairs started to get packed around 11! They also have another room with tables where the smoking area is. The second floor didn't open till 11:30! I didn't realize how big that dance floor was till it opened!   Music was good downstairs AND upstairs! The bars were pretty big and the bartenders make the drinks really strong! Had an AMF from the bar downstairs and had another one upstairs. Tasted different, but both were strong!  Crowd's OKAY, it's free so it attracts all different types of people.... I agree with most of the reviews on here that this place is straight up ghetto! There were atleast three fights that night! Bouncers and security would push their way through and shove anybody to stop a fight! You can imagine how hard it would be to enjoy the good music playing when you gotta move out of the way for the bouncers or move away from a fight five feet away from you.  With that said, my friends and I enjoyed the club's music. I can't say the same for the club's "ATMOSPHERE", crowd, and the ghetto-ness! So one star for GOOD MUSIC and another for STRONG DRINKS! It definitely helps to be with good company and to sip on a strong drink to enjoy a place like this!

NdX6UacaCOqqxfllgsxS0g.review_text: Last night, I went to Atmosphere with 8 friends.  Actually, I brought them all there based on my recommendation as I'd been to the venue several times, even before it was renamed Atmosphere.  After checking on the nightly events on Atmosphere's website, I saw that they had something special going on for Sat with an open bar between 9:30-10:30pm and no cover until 11pm.  That's pretty much enough justification to get everybody to swing by and put up with the stiff parking fees.  When we arrived at 9:30pm, the door was locked with no indication that anything was going on.  Really annoyed, as I had 8 guests standing around, I tried calling to find out what's going on.  Nobody answered the phones.  All my calls went to voicemail.  This totally sucked.    Then, as if by a miracle, somebody unchained the locks and put out the vile velvet ropes that would pointlessly torture their eager patrons for hours to come.  I asked about the situation and the door man merely indicated to form a line at the ropes while he shuffled across the street to stuff his gullet with a greasy slice of pizza.  Finally, 9:45pm swung around and the hosts finally get their act together and start checking IDs.  I indicated that I had put myself on the guest list and brought along 8 friends to help pad Atmosphere's wallets.  Ridiculously, the hostess tells me that not only were my friends not on the guest list, they would have to pay the bloody $20 cover even though it was before 11pm.  But, she said that we would still get our shot at the open bar, which she said would be extended to 10:45pm to make up for the full hour.  So, cold and clinging to optimism, we caved and paid up.  When we sidled up to the bar, we were informed by the hip bartender that only well drinks were available.  Errrr, we grunted and ordered up whatever simple shots of vodka, rum, and tequila we could think up.  In about 30 minutes, we had put down 3-4 rounds and was getting used to the overly loud music that nobody was dancing to.  Then again, with all the aspiring Lane Bryant customers filling up the joint, I could see no point in trying.  Sensing that I was obviously not drunk enough, I returned for another round and was told by the same hip bartender that the open bar was closed by 10:30pm, so lame.    By 11pm, we could see that the scene wasn't improving and decided to cut bait on our cover charge.  I only hoped that I was sufficiently glazed over by alcohol to not betray my merciful gaze of pity on the shivering ladies still vying to get the night started.

CZ1bprnm0HseWZFY5KV2oA.review_text: This place will always have a special place in my heart, real talk.  First off, I'm not a fan of spots where I have to wear my "wedding shoes". So +1 for Atmosphere. Don't get me wrong. I love suiting up and getting all GQ and what have you. I love stepping my white collar game up. But at a lounge/club, I'm just trying to "dance with my girls" LOL (fellas don't you love that line?) and I want to be rocking the most comfy shoes ever. But I digress.  Second off, I hate places that hold the line, but that's just par for the course. I hate when fellow Yelpers give lounges/clubs bad reviews based on things that cannot be controlled. Of course lines will be held, c'mon now.  Third off, once we finally got in (yeah we had to wait, but remember, par for the course) the music was way on point. Any time I walk in and "When The Last Time" by the Clipse is playing, you know it's going to be a good night. Smaller bar section downstairs, and a much larger dancefloor with a much larger bar upstairs.  Fourth off? You know you're at a "club" not bar when you got bathroom attendants at the joint. I was disappointed with dude's gum selection, to be quite honest with you. But he was Quickdraw McGraw with the paper towels as soon as I was done washing my hands, MY GAWD. Good shit man.  Fifth off, drinks are reasonably priced (for The City). Girls are way friendlier up here. And less snobby too. ATTN fellas: just don't get all grabby and pushy with the ladies, and you'll have a fun night, I promise you.  Overall, it's your basic club spot without all the bourgeois fanfare (everyone's entitled to their own opinion of course). The vibe was real cool. Good music, good peoples, good times.  Most likely I'll be back, but I wouldn't want to ruin the mystique of my first night at this spot. It's kind of like the Seinfeld theory. You got to go out while you're on top. And if I had a pretty amazing time here my first time here, why should I come back if that night can't be topped?  Or can it?  *DUN DUN DUN*

DAIF6BwUEBCPqPvhNby9IQ.review_text: I stumbled. I slipped. I fell. I told an employee to fuck himself and gave him the finger. I stumbled some more. I slipped a few more times. I even fell over again and again.    Sure, they made numerous threats and put me in several "time outs" (I don't remember shit; my friends told me). Yet they still let me stay.  And, the DJ played "ain't no fun."   Thanks Atmosphere!

lk8dCBbF-CNfWTtGW2RW1Q.review_text: Worst experience ever! I can't even believe I have to give them a star. Everyone here is new on the job and had no sense of self worth. Please go anywhere else but here and save yourself the headache.

RFTVBFlgM0cqvl1daywfjQ.review_text: Thank God we were on a guest's list otherwise I would have been hella bitter about paying to get in. I just didn't have as much fun here as described by some of you. The music was good at first in the front room, but then slowly got worse as the night went on, especially in the main room. There wasn't a ton of people there that night, and it was mostly a sausage fest with the exception of a group of hoodrat drunk beezies trying to grind on the "stage". I'm pretty sure at least one of them got date-raped that night, but no matter. We amused ourselves with a group of fun dudes that were recently transplanted from the Philippines and ready to bust a move, so it wasn't a complete waste of going out. As for service, the bartenders downstairs were more open than the ones upstairs, who seemed cold to me. And parking as usual for the area was garage only, but there is one like 2 doors down so it was pretty convenient for those of you not cabbing. I probably wouldn't go back.

khzZyHKzS5fLxfUi1Cu9iw.review_text: so really this place sucked when i went on saturday night with my sister and friends.  it was not busy at all when we got there at midnight and the music was booboo.  we should have saw the sign when about 15 girls left the place on our way in. i liked this place better when it was the zebra lounge.

coEX0WGa92jJZ0Wgn1WRMg.review_text: My SJ friends spin here sometimes so I came out one night to support, but unfortunately missed their set =(  Well, the positive thing about that is that now we can all drink and dance!! =)  Drinks were okay...two bars (one downstairs and one upstairs). Love that both of them are strategically located so that no one waiting at the bar ends up blocking the dance floors.    The dance floor downstairs is kinda tiny but the one upstairs is pretty spacious. Love that it wasn't a packed sardine can.  I like being on the dance floor when I don't have to continuously say excuse me or sorry to the person dancing next to me because I keep bumping into them, but also like when others are close enough so that I can still feel their vibin groove.  Be careful of those stairs now!!...it was amusing watching many stumbling down or missing a few steps AHAHAHA

D9mgcl6MFE3vRKTVadFFdQ.review_text: This place used to be called Latitude. Now it's called Atmosphere. WTF is up with all the scientific, geological names?!?! yelp.com/biz/club-latitu…

rZ9Ckrw8wwNDWrx_tzZT8A.review_text: This place is decent.  I ended up at Atmosphere, simply because the party bus I was on brought me here. This was my first time at this club. The bus got to Atmosphere just before 11:00. Since we were on a bus, my group and I put into VIP line. Getting into the club was quite fast. I believe our party got into the club quickly because our party was mostly females. At the door we did the normal ID and pat down. During my pat down, the security advised to keep my pants up. WEIRD THING though, the bouncer pulled up my pants for me. The bouncer advised the guy before me the same, but he didn't ill up his pants. Just saying kind of weird.  When we got inside, the club was just filling up. The club is two stories. The first floor is mainly one bar and a bunch or vip tables. The second floor consists of a long bar, a few vip tables to side the bar and a stage. The bathrooms are located in the back of the second story.When I hit up the bar, and got normal shot and beer. Of course, I tipped well, which makes a big difference. For the rest of the night the female bartender was very attentive to tending to my service. Even when I was behind some people.  The dance floor gets pretty crowded. There is a good blend of people. The bouncers were being cool that night. My group had good time, so I can't complain about anything. I just wasn't impressed much, though.

MO-RUw75OAhIc4Uzml348w.review_text: Minus 4 stars for: -Sticky bottle service booth seats.  -Bottle service girl was rude, non-attentive, and not pleasant at all. -Horrible ventilation. -Dude next to us was basically passed out in his own vomit and securrity did nothing!  -Unnecessary strict dress code. Too many questionable gold chains and boxer shorts in one club if you ask me.  One star because bottle service is blocked off to prevent unknowns from invading and the bathroom lady is really polite.

xMKpXNaicvI-BgSA69yp9A.review_text: I came here with a group of about 20 people on a PARTY BUS!!!  We were all pretty toasted when we got here but I swear, people wanted to be us.. We hella brought the party!!    There are no in and outs.  I repeat, there are no in and outs.  You have to know this because there are 2 pizza places across the street that were tempting all of us but they wouldn't let us go get any.. Lame but we went after they closed so HA!    The first level of this club is hip hop music with a fully stocked bar.  Upstairs is house music with another fully stocked bar and big dance floor.  This was my favorite room.  There is also a lounge/VIP/chill area with couches, tables and an aquarium and outside of that is the smoking area.  The bathroom attendant was nice and I felt bad I didn't have any cash for her..   Atmosphere is a fun club in North Beach with a good mix of people.  I wish they had in and outs though which is the only thing I was annoyed about.  I liked the upstairs room better and there never seemed to be a line for the bar!  Good times at Atmosphere!

3qX8ok7ZmPbig-t6KR5pRQ.review_text: Drove up here for my friend's Bday. Came after 11 so I had to pay a $20 cover. You walk straight up to the door, and it says strict dress code policy. I get told by a worker that my clothes may not work. I was wearing jeans, t-shirt, vest, and jacket. I was like ill button up my vest and it'll be cool. Later on in the night I see a tall white guy dressed like Napoleon Dynamite on the dance floor. *Shrugs*.The club was poppin' nonetheless.. The women that night were either really beautiful or as my friend puts it "Shamu." The club has two floors with different music on each floor. I thought this was cool, because it gives you options if you aren't feeling the music. The bartenders are really cool, and beautiful I might add. Overall, my experience of the place is positive, and would come back on special occasions.

aKll5eCfS95ko13OqhJAbA.review_text: Huge dance floor, okay crowd.  Not that full though for the line outside.  Overall average club.  They let my gf and I in for half price though which was nice.

3j8FDsMePNYwD-1faD1jjQ.review_text: So here's a breakdown of why i gave this club 4 stars:  1 star for location = in the middle of broadway street, with other bars and clubs, places to eat late at night and tons of people wandering around. party on the streets!  1 star for music/setting = the most popular hip hop, pop and dance tracks. you know what you're getting. tons of dance space, although it gets packed around midnight. dark, dirty and fun as hell. AND there's a lounge area where you can just chill and sit.   1 star for people = there are tons of asians at this club. i'm asian so it was all good. besides that, it's a fun crowd.  1 star for fun factor = i've been here twice. once to try it out and another time for a VIP party. both times have been awesome. the place gets popin' around midnight.   -1 star because of location. it's in the heart of broadway. parking and traffic on a friday/saturday night is a nightmare. get here early or expect to pay more for parking than for cover.

dzbtggAUQ-i3-so3g1pDmw.review_text: Been here a grand total of.......... 2 times. haha.   We stopped here on our partybus on Halloween and last Saturday when some friends of friends threw a huge bday bash. I had a great time both times. the decor isnt as grand as the picture shows.. but its got a dancefloor & a bar. what more do you need??  -So i Love, love, LOVE  the roomy dance floors. Not roomy as in empty, but roomy as in.. i could move & flee from creepers if necessary.  & watch out for crazy beezys that like to swing their legs back when they dance [wtf], almost got stabbed in the leg. o_O   -VIP/ bottle service area in the back was a lil crowded though, but there was a shitload of people.   -My only complaint is that the bartenders a taddd on the slow side [upstairs at least]  -also my kamikaze didnt have enough alkie so i stuck to patron after that.  -the bar downstairs def. had quicker service & bigger shots.   & in the bottle service line.. i encountered one of the NICEST staffs everrr at a club. like whOa. not the usual douchebag. maybe he was a manager.  2 of our friends were not on the bottle service list & the guestlist line wrapped around the building, so he was nice enough to let them in with us, only payin the cover, which was fine by us.   the venue itself is very chill, i would def. return.

bBRPy8zUvNc0NGbGmkjrZg.review_text: Atmosphere is a small club, with a capacity of just 200. The space inside is very roughly divided into three spaces: a dance floor in the dark next to the DJ, a space next to the bar with a few seats to aid chilling out, and a space by the stairs where the toilets and a second dance floor which seems dead. My friends and I had to queue for 10 minutes to get in and each paid a $15 entry fee, but it was totally worth it. Even at full capacity, there's space to chill out and take a breather, something that PP deserve a lot of credit for ensuring, rather than attempt to squeeze every last possible punter in.  One of the best aspects of the experience though was the crowd and the general atmosphere there: people were simply there to enjoy and bop to the music in a completely uninhibited yet space-respecting fashion. This desire was underlined by the very few camera flashes throughout the night - people were there to have fun, not to show the Facebook world just how hip they were.   The bar was pretty reasonable too, with a good range of spirits, beer, cocktails and even some wine at decent prices: bottled beer was $5  and $10 for AMFs. Service was friendly and very quick.  And the music? Simply superb, with DJ serving up an expertly crafted mix of acid jazz, electro, hip hop, reggae and a range of other genres too, all through the club's incredible sound system.   I recommend this place if you do not like to be on the crowdy side and to be with your friends.

_64q3QQbUg4BknYri7fCPA.review_text: this place is the hottttt shittttt  great ATMOSPHERE (literally) Fast & friendly bartenders with heavy hands...  Definately will be back!

2aUyAi0HLA8g2XVSuOZ5-A.review_text: Uuuuugh.  Went here for Halloween. The crowd somehow achieved being (mostly) overweight, slutty, and grumpy.  There was none of that tipsy camaraderie that you usually get in a night out dancing/drinking.  The bartenders were sloppy-drunk. The DJ was also sloppy--whenever he changed songs he would mix in the second song, everyone would get excited and start boppin to the new beat, and then he would either slow waaaaaaaay down or pause, leaving the dance floor hanging for a good 20 seconds, kind of wanting to dance but not really being able to groove to the weird mash-up.  And he did that EVERY SINGLE TIME. And for all this I paid $15! Wtf! The one plus was that they had a lot of seating....which they closed off at 1 a.m., just when everyone's feet started to give out from the Halloween heels.    Full disclosure: I was pretty sober for this whole experience.  But I don't think that any amount of drunkenness could have made Atmosphere a place that I would go back to.

pJ1SKD4XZr-6p9FnG8yZ2w.review_text: Nothing is better than some good convincing.   My friends who share the same birthday as me convinced me to celebrate our birthday in SF this year. I was super hesitant, but they somehow managed to get me to go. I'm glad that I went because it was a different experience.  As I entered Atmosphere, I noticed the mirror that people mentioned in previous reviews. It was fun to watch some people walking towards the mirror thinking it was another room. I wonder if they put that there on purpose?   Atmosphere is spacious and there are two bars. I noticed that the bar upstairs poured their shots into plastic cups versus the bar downstairs pouring their shots into regular shot glasses. Not sure which one people prefer, but I just wanted to give you all a heads up.  The music was pretty good that particular night  that I went and I liked how the DJ didn't play songs over and over.  I would definitely recommend this place to others. It's just kind of odd where this place is located. Haha.

GQwiY_PvTUtdtnt8cCjmfQ.review_text: I've come to a realization that maybe 4 or 5 venues in SF are real clubs. The rest are just makeshift restaurant/bars.  I've been to Atmopshere before when it was Latitudes but man things haven't changed at all.  It's still hot as hell.  Bottle service is pretty much serve yourself and the hold up of the line was even worse than most clubs in Hollywood.  Instead of having AC.. they put those square fans you buy at Walmart and propped them at the top of the ceiling. Yes, very classy.    They have a large rectangular platform propped against the back of the wall where drunk ass hoodrats can get up there and shake their ass.  That platform didn't look sturdy at all.. all taped up with electrical tape... it was an accident waiting to happen.  Promoters were Asian but it was pretty mixed actually.   Black, Latino, White, Asian, you got everyone.    They barricade a small section of the front of the club for a "smoking patio."  They need to make that shit bigger.  Parking is atrocious as others have said, so get there early.

W46UkrAvPokkWfXno1cD6g.review_text: This was one of my best first experiences with a club/lounge in SF. After you get past the fact that it's surrounded by strip clubs and other rather trashy hangouts, and past the homeland security-like check at the front door, this place is fantastic!  I love the space - like a loft in the meatpacking district of NYC. There was always a spot for my friend and I to sit (so necessary when you're wearing 4 inch heels!), and plenty of room for us to get our groove on. The dance floor is huge! I didn't have to step on anyone's feet to get them off of my back. Not everyone looked like a model, but overall the people there tried to look good and avoided the kinds 6 inch platform heels and spandex.   The night we were there (last saturday), they had free lotus vodka until 11pm. And somehow, after arriving at 10:52, we managed to fit in 2 vodka crans. Classy, I know. The bartender, Nicole, was incredibly nice, attentive, fast, and had us take a free shot with her! She was so much fun that we didn't want to leave the bar. But we eventually did. Why you ask? THE FISH TANK. Nothing says baller more than a purple-blue fish tank. I think every club needs to make it a staple decoration.   Finally, at the end of the night we were waiting outside for our friend (Arnaud, the DJ of the night), and they ushered us back inside to let us wait in the warmth even though they were closed. It gave me a chance to chat with Greg, the bouner, who was surprisingly nice and fun!  Overall, I can't wait to go back, and I wish I had enough friends to rent the place out for a killer party. Hmmmm, maybe for a future Yelp event?

6IgNz1Nl49tou_KzXKnf4Q.review_text: The worst place ever....the floors are  bad and the customer service very poor! i was there for my birthday bash...and not the bash i expected....had gone with the limo service....we had paid everything in advance so everyone could go in free....but they made us wait in the line and pay for the whole damn thing .....music was shitty....drinks very expensive....the only nice thing abt this place.....umm i cant give it less than 1 star..dont go here ppl....they will charge u for everytime u step out of the club,,....honestly...stay away..there are much better clubs than this one.....

176KIDWfALoQRtRlKEJBFA.review_text: My rating is SOLELY based on my experience with them for their New Year's Eve 2011 bash. I'd never been to Atmosphere before that, and I haven't been since. So, yenno, keep that in mind, and whatnot. My friends and I decided to finally get off our lazy adult asses and do something for NYE because I was finally going to be in California (instead of crappy Michigan) and we wanted to enjoy ourselves. We didn't want to do a stuffy hotel party, we didn't wanna deal with a house party, so we decided to go to a club. Atmosphere seemed to be a good balance, because it was near a few restaurants we were considering for dinner that night. Also, we bought our tickets in mid-November, so they were $56/ea for open bar. Yeah. That was pretty awesome. The bouncers were nice guys and were quick at getting folks in, and the bartenders seemed pretty good. The DJs played a good mix of music downstairs. Upstairs, though, the music was INFINITELY better. And I'm not just saying that cuz one of our good friends from high school, DJ William Wes (djWilliamWes.blogspot.com), was DJ'ing upstairs. We had a lot of fun dancing and drinking and overall having a good time. They also had a smoking area outside which served a friend of mine rather well; it was also nice because the smoking area was attached to a small room with chairs that got a very, very nice breeze, which provided a nice cool break from the hotness of the club. I can see where the "ghetto" bit might come into play though.... I think there was less of that on NYE though because most people who spend the money to come out on NYE aren't gonna be the same types of folks who cause a ton of shit at a nightclub on a regular basis. We did, however, get to watch some dude get taken out by a bouncer, whilst in a chokehold. Did I mention the bouncer was like, 6 inches shorter than the dude he was dragging out? It was AMAZING. Haha!! We didn't stay too late past midnight because my old lady ass was exhausted. We still had a lot of fun, though.

H18PDEJ_YcD5e86bwj01Hg.review_text: Atmosphere was the designated spot for a joint birthday extravaganza.  Perhaps the party bus ride from San Jose was a fun party in itself, but I was not impressed with Atmosphere!  Maybe it's a hit-or-miss kinda place.  The bar LOOKS crowded but the bartenders are efficient which brings the wait time down, sweet.  The place, although decently sized was cut in half as they kept the back bar closed and tried to pack the front of the house.  This is a great marketing scheme but detracts from the place's potential.  The restroom is at the back of the club and everyone was up front so walking past an empty, quiet back room was strange.  Having an entirely empty back room made the place look weak.  Therefore I don't need to return.  And for smokers, you're allowed a narrow, regulated area where hanging out is not permitted. At all.  Once you finish your cig that's it, back in you go.

SXfvHWScLghzoTSBqb_e6w.review_text: i gotta admit, i was pleasantly surprised by this place. i'm not much of a club person at all but i had a great time here!   my friend had her birthday celebration here and had a VIP section reserved and our names on the guestlist. we left early to  make sure we could find parking and have time to wait in line, and got there a little after 10. we were waiting in line when the bouncer came over and told our party and everyone waiting behind us to form another line, which ensured speedy entrance. that's probably one of the shortest waits i've ever had to get into a club. i don't know why people were complaining about the ID scan and quick photo, because it literally takes 3 seconds. it's also reassuring that there won't be underage boppers or shady felons inside.   the inside is huge and ventilated. two bars, equipped with speedy bartenders that still made a damned good [and STRONG] drink. the lower level was more mellow, loungy music, whereas the upstairs had more uptempo songs, as well as an additional CLEAN restroom. they even had a lady in there hand you paper towels when you finished washing your hands.   and the DJ was awesome. didn't play the same generic shit i hear on the radio everyday, lots of old school jams. he even played "you" by lucy pearl which got my drunk ass all OVER that dance floor, seriously.   sidenote, my boyfriend and i were in the little area where you can smoke outside and he was incapable of standing up straight, almost knocking over the barrier. the bouncer was actually pretty nice about it and didn't kick him out which is odd. come to think of it, all the bouncers and security i came across were pretty nice.  so yes, i'd hella come back.

6e0khvHCOJU1YTCx8gDfSw.review_text: I went here this past weekend for a friend celebrating his birthday. We got a late start heading up to the city and it took us awhile to find parking. There is $10 valet type garage a few blocks away (closer to waterfront), much easier to park here then trying to get into the section right next to Atmosphere.   The line was insane and barely moving and definitely no way to make it in by 11 on the guest list. There was a group ahead of us that started out with 7 people and turned into 40 something. The line barley moved for over 45 minutes since this group became insanely large. Luckily a very friendly bouncer approached me and my friends and showed us to the front of line, very much appreciated! This saved us from our misery.  We immediately went upstairs to the second dance floor and to the bar. The bartender chick was inconsiderate. Several guys approached the bar after me was able to get drinks faster than I. I asked my boyfriend to stand at the bar next to me to get her attention and it must have worked. The bartender asked what drinks he wanted just as I was complaining to friends that the bartender is only serving guys. She must have heard since she told the boyfriend he would get my drinks first, then his.  This is one crazy crowded place. I saw a girl passed out on the floor in the stall and chicks dancing on a platform fighting. Overall the music was good and we had a fun time.. Thanks again to the bouncer who made this a higher rating.

bkMtv1i0m3wYTnWjezNDIA.review_text: Bar far the worst so called club I've been to. Full with tourist that don't know  the city. Complete sweat box. Filled people documenting the event with cameras. Last thing I want when I'm drunk is a shining light in my face. They also had a flyer that said before 11 get in cheaper but the person collecting cover charge didn't stay true to the flyer. pWKwDWJV60tbgAnxlLGr9A.review_text: The club is divided into three parts: one dance floor by the bar area right by the entrance, a lounge area behind the bar, and a larger dance floor as you make your way in further into the club by the bathrooms.   I came here for a friend's 22nd and the only areas they had open were the smaller dance floor by the entrance and the lounge area. For a Friday night, there weren't that many people. The drinks weren't that strong and the music was mediocre. Maybe I came at a bad night? The interior of the club would definitely be more of a lounge than a party-rar-rar dance club. The lights were really dim and it gave off a jazz-bar vibe. The walls looked like they were wooden. The one good thing about it was that there was no cover for us that day because a guy in our group knew someone who worked there. It's not somewhere I'd be coming back again.

lsafra7Gn8thEJij8BaxGg.review_text: How the hell does this place get 3.5 stars???  I went here for a friend's birthday. It was OH-SO LAME.  DJ sucked so hard.  The first bartender (some asian dude), made a HORRIBLE long island for me. I saw him add WATER to my drink. And yes, I'm 100% sure it was WATER & ICE. Thing was $11 or $12 for a small cup of Long Island. RIDICULOUS.  5 men tried to get my best friend's attention by trying to get a hold of her hand/arm. GROSS. Whatever happened to just going up to a girl and asking her to dance. Don't touch us. We don't know where your hands have been.  This place made a very bad first impression. I hated it there. The music did NOT flow together at ALL. Not even once.  The people there gave off a weird vibe.  Never going back here again. EVER. I don't care who's bday it is. I absolutely REFUSE to go here again.

1Mb_leDMNQBZ6NXEJ_vB8Q.review_text: It already seemed like a bad idea when we realized that this club didn't have a line at all and the club next door had a line all the way down Broadway.   Pros: 1. The AC is on full blast 2. They have bathroom attendants whose sole purpose is to hand you paper towels and offer you assorted mints.  Cons: 1. Floors are sticky from people who were already drunk by 11 PM 2. ONLY played Top 40 all night. WHY?!??! 3. Yeah, I'll say it: GHETTO 4. Drink sizes are small  Overall, I can't say this night is reflective of all their nights since my roommate has been here last year and she's loved it then. However, they can definitely improve the music and tacky atmosphere.

1lh8p7T6j6GRJiQ00CzXEA.review_text: Eh...Not my choice of venue for a night out in San Francisco. Although Atmosphere is one of the better nightclubs on the Broadway strip, it still falls short of a decent SF nightclub.   I've been to Atmosphere about a total of two times. Each time was for a friend's birthday. The good thing about this place is that there is tons of space. If you're looking to host a big event such as a birthday...then this place would be an option for you to consider.  Other than that, nothing really special. Drinks were pretty expensive, $28 for a total of three drinks. Bathroom was dirty, music was okay, super crowded and the crowd was ghetto. I don't know what it is about Broadway that attracts ghetto people.  Every nightclub and block on that street seems to be full of them.  Oh, and good luck with parking. There is a parking lot right next to Atmosphere. Convenient for your feet but not your wallet. $20 to park for a couple of hours. Not really worth it if you ask me....

8526ZJhSR9CEX-vfjSFD-w.review_text: i dont remember much. but what i do remember from the night...  wasnt happening. a little too empty for my liking. nothing special about the place that would make me want to go back.  i definitely remember the cute bartender. he even bought us a round. that's something worth remembering. haha

rqquMUC5p9HmYq9rXXQS2Q.review_text: I gave 2 stars because I love the music they play here. The DJ plays the best hip hop & top 40 hits out of any club in the city.... But other than that everything else about this club sucks. I've been here three times.
