Don't mess with ICU Networking ENT. They don't keep their word and their totally sketchy. Never going to that club again.

nJ4OL4_yR4o3wzJcmBiXog.review_text: Dirty bathrooms Sticky floors We bought a bottle of belvedere, but we believe it was mixed with water or something else. We could barely taste the flavor of the vodka, even with an 80% mix.  Rude bouncers The name does not live up to itself Ghetto  Never again!

_KDforIDsQS6bIaJi0_V0g.review_text: GHETTO.  And that's all there is to say about that.

3cnIyELXdZa9C9nFH5NXtg.review_text: Rating night clubs in SF is always a difficult thing to do because there is this expectation that in a big city you want these big Vegas style clubs, but that's really not what SF is about.  There is a land crunch in SF, so almost any nook of space could be turned into a bar/lounge/night club.  What really matters to people out here are music and crowd.  With that being said, people's tastes change all the time...  If you are in a hip hop/top 40 mood and just want to dance, Atmosphere is a great spot for that.  It's a natural layout for a dance floor and offer plenty of space.  The music was also on point.  Not too much of that EDM stuff that you can't really dance too.    Bartenders and staff were friendly and are pretty fast, considering the amount of people at the bar.  Crowd was okay, a good mix of people.   So if you are looking for that type of club that plays current hip hop and top 40 and just want to drink and dance and have a good time, Atmosphere is not a bad choice.

RKUWxfF2kIMuvDREbCHWBA.review_text: had a great time here! the staff was super friendly and the music was on point. bottle service was amazing and very affordable! highly recommend!

_gn_iXnslPT6rEG49908tA.review_text: Was referred to this club by another bar. Went in and was asked for a 15 dollar cover for 2. We started walking away and the owner got us in free. It was slightly dead when we arrived at 10:45 but was super crowded by 11. Huge place, but only on Saturday are all the floors open. Bar service was fast and they had a drink special. Music was good. Top 40 mixed with some old school jams. Dj was hot and looked like he was enjoying himself. Crowd was a mix, mostly tourists. All of the women were dressed in tiny dresses and everyone was dancing. I think this is a great place if you go with a group and just want to dance and have a good time.

y8jGUyVXaTgOPZujogCvDw.review_text: I was here for a birthday a few weeks back. In the 3 hours that I was there, I saw 2 fights.. During the first one, I was shoved and almost fell. Smh. Also, many of the girls here just mug all day! What gives! What are you here for!?!? Just to judge all the other females? Jeez. Get a life. Go dance! Go do something other than try to cause a fight or make people uncomfortable! Ugh. Never coming back here.

59QzQ3-dmOD1USV2hQpwkw.review_text: The time I went to see Nas in North Beach on Sunday at Atmosphere was great...except for the fact that it was Sunday, I was in North Beach, and Nas never showed up.

YfwBiRftj-mMTW5XZBNFmw.review_text: I'm not picky about my clubs--as long as they are spacious, have acceptable decor, have a good area to take a breather, and serve liquor, I am happy. I actually really like this club. Perhaps if I didn't have a good experience, I'd rate this place lower, but I had a great experience, so that certainly helps. It was apparently ladies' night when we came here (and it certainly was a ladies night for us this particular night!) so the ladies got free champagne. The champagne wasn't bad, either, though my fellow lady friends didn't like it and gave theirs to me (more for me!)--I reckon they are the vodka and Patron types. I like that there is a lounge area, and then a large dance floor area, which you enter by going up some stairs (a bit difficult in stilettos... and maybe with a drink or two in your system).  The dance floor area is super spacious, and that is a definite plus in my book. The music was, of course, of your typical top 40s hits, so it was alright. The bar experience was also good--we didn't have to wait too long to get the bartender's attention. However, because we were a group of girls, guys kept trying to get in on the action! That was slightly annoying, because I hate creepers, but we simply just danced away, and we still had a great night!

2KcDZEeBiBi7XcfSPZLWDw.review_text: It's the old Zebra Lounge, nothing really has changed inside except the name!  Went here this past Saturday with 10 of my girlfriends.  Getting in was easy (of course with 10 girls).  Rooms are set up great. Small room/bar in the front room, with a side VIP lounge and then upstairs a much larger room, with more VIP tables. Bartenders were cute and poured generously only peculiar problem that we found out was the bartenders charge differently from upstairs and the downstairs bars. Weird, considering it was the same exact drink (I noticed another Yelp reviewer noticed that too).  Get your act together guys on your bar pricing!  I mostly go to clubs with the main purpose of getting low and really dancing, the dee jays were pretty bad.  Both rooms kept switching from more fun popular hip hop, to old school slower hip hop and then threw in house music.  It just didn't quite flow together to keep you moving.  Got great drinks and then moved on to another club that night.  I'd probably go back to check it out again in a few more months, perhaps after the dee jay figures it all out.  Oh...for all the ladies out there, the bathrooms were SUPER clean.

eKUGKQRE-Ywi5dY55_zChg.review_text: Get DRUNK, I mean "Drink" for a Cause? I'm so there...  Let me preface by saying that I do NOT like partying on Broadway; too many Po-Po's, the crowd tends to be rowdy and ghetto and parking SUCKS.   I've come to Atmosphere/A3 about 5 times for clubbing events but last Friday was the very first time I actually had fun at A3 BEFORE the club even opened!  On February 4th, my friends and I came for a "Drink for a Cause" Happy Hour Event hosted my mPowering from 6 PM-10 PM. Since this was a charitable event, the crowd were Young Professionals in their late 20's to mid 30's, mainly Asian. This is of course is not representative of the typical club night there which was very refreshing.   There was a DJ spinning Top 40s, Hip-Hop and Mashups. Not sure if it was the alkie, but my friend and I couldn't help but comment about how good the music was. Needless to say, after 1...2...3...4 drinks/shots later, one friend ended up on the stage, one doing "The Sprinkler" and the other doing "The Lawnmower". As for me, well let's just say, I was ready to throw my own Trampoline Party until my inner voice of reason told me this is a "charity" event and NOT your typical Saturday night of debauchery. :T  Again this "Drink for a Cause" HH Event is not representative of the typical club night at A3, so here's the nitty gritty. First and foremost, the crowd and music varies depending on who's promoting, so make sure to check the calendar on A3's website.   C O V E R:  FREE before 11 PM if you're on the Promoter's GL, otherwise it's $20 at the door.  L I N E: Dependent on the Promoters and how large of a crowd they can draw in, but I've never had to wait in line more than 10 minutes.  D R E S S  C O D E: Club attire; no sports wear.  C R O W D: Varies; but I've only come to A3 for Asian hosted parties which currently occurs the 1st Saturday of every month. I haven't been to one of the Asian parties here in over 8 months, but the crowd tends to be the same for this promotion company; early 20s to mid 20s and on the fobby side.   M U S I C: During the Asian hosted parties, they only play Top 40s, Hip Hop, and Mashups.  B A R S: There's 2 bars; one in the front room and one in the main back room with 3-4 (non-friendly) bartenders working at each bar.   D R I N K S: $9 for top shelf cocktail and shots. No CC minimum.  Drinks are inconsistent. On Friday, I had 4 Goose Club Sodas and 2 of them tasted like plain Club Sodas.  T A B L E  S E R V I C E: *Bottles start at $150 and need to be book in advanced through the Promoter or the the club *Front Room - There are about 4 tables for bottle service which is in a more semi-private room *Back Main Room - There's 3 booths for bottle service that overlooks the dancefloor  A M B I A N C E / D É C O R: Modern industrial warehouse...  The semi-private front room has exposed red brick walls and a beautiful illuminated fish tank. The front bar area has a pool table and a small dancing area.   The main backroom is more like a big open warehouse space so you can mingle and dance. There's also a stage in the backroom where you're free to dance on BUT just be careful going up/down the stairs. The ventilation is very poor in the back room when it's crowded.   WARNING: The floors are very slippery when wet so ladies be careful when you're strutting around in your 5 inch stilettos.   R E S T R O O M S: The front room has one stall for men and one stall for women. The back room has 5-6 stalls for women. There's normally a bathroom attendant so the bathrooms are normally well-kept except sometimes they're out of toilet seat covers.   P A R K I N G: HORRENDOUS! The nearest lot is 2-3 buildings away near Sutra. Weekdays is $15 and Weekends is $20. The lot normally fills up by 10:30-10:45 PM, so try to get there early.   If it weren't for the fact that my friends and I had a blast during HH, A3 would be getting 2 stars. Apparently, we had so much fun that we met several people at Bubble Lounge later that night that said, "Hey, I saw you guys at A3 for that HH..." while we had NO recollection. Yes, welcome to our HHs!

cowU-HmtSkvUuu89poykBQ.review_text: This place reminds me of Facebook or MySpace when you see someone's picture and they got you thinking "Damnnnnnn." Then you see them in person, and you're like "wtf?"  Atmosphere is a lot dingier than presented online, and it really sucks when they don't open their second dance floor because the first one is cramped. This isn't a good thing considering the booty hounds here. I know, I know...You're thinking "But there are booty hounds at every club!" While I don't doubt that, I must say the persistence, aggression, and sheer perverseness of their faces definitely set them apart here.   There was little to no wait at the bar and the bartenders were nice and friendly. Their music was okay (the usual popular radio stuff). But this just doesn't cut it. I would feel utterly ripped off if I paid to get in this club. And I'd feel betrayed if I drove all the way to sf just to go here.   Maybe it's better on special event nights? Who knows.

lXKjU1d7uy4aG0c5dNTATw.review_text: Went here on a Saturday night for drinks and to meet with friends. Typically, not a place I'd go as a club/venue choice. The open space was nicely used as their tables/bottle service is privately tucked in another room, away from the dance floor which I liked. The music was okay and the crowd is mostly Asian considering it's right in between Chinatown and North Beach.   They do have coat check, a large bar and a larger dancehall in the back where the restrooms are.   Not sure if I'd come back here again, it was cool to experience the North Beach club scene for a change.

AIPP8x9W-4-szE87dHwvkA.review_text: I am ridiculously late in writing this...as my group and I went back when Common was in the building and performed for a little bit...    We had a great time!! The bottle service was on point, and the overall accomodations provided by the staff were well worth coming back.  Music was good, drinks were cool too.  We'll definitely be back...

2HjKeEJPFK4fqTkaIq5VOA.review_text: Ghetto, ronchy dancing crowd. Are we at east Compton's high school dance? I guess it's what to expect on Broadway. As for the venue, the set-up's alright, the bartenders don't look like they care to be there, and the DJs again played music that I would hear at a high school dance. The well cocktails are some of the worst I've ever had. I guess you can't ask for much at $6 a pop. Probably won't be coming back.

ZXlBdMllPMEUr0C14vH3ZQ.review_text: My first time at "da club" in San Francisco... I'm more of a gritty bar person, but I thought I'd have to check one out eventually.  I took a star off because their "guest list"  thing wasn't working on the website, I'm not trying to pay $15 to get in.  I even emailed them and got no such response, so I had to cough up the money upon entry ANYWAY.  Lame.  The music is the typical club music, the guys are the typical creepsters (although they were SUPER short the night I went... I'm 5'6" and was wearing 4" heels, towering over those slick haired boyzz). Also, there's this HUGE mirror on the 1st floor... got really dirty when those H-Rats were grinding up on it, hilarious.  Overall: The drinks weren't too expensive, quite strong actually.  The neighborhood ain't all that... Not sure if I'd come again, maybe for another birthday or special occasion.

jkiinjUy8RUZKzW5gBpXNg.review_text: Atmosphere is a joke, and if you fall for it, shame on you.    We were on the guest list and were told free entry and free Patron before 11, so we headed over a little after ten.  Great gimmick, since they clearly weren't letting anyone in until 11.    The line, which wrapped around the building, never moved in the 15 minutes we waited before giving up, except when other people gave up and left.    With pathetic, deceptive business practices like this, I really hope this place fails miserably.

Wtyshwguv-DEyWq7kTCy_g.review_text: I went here for a friend's birthday last weekend. I was a bit irritated about waiting 30-40 minutes in line to get in and about the 20 dollar cover. But wooow was it worth it!  As soon as I got in, there was a coat check. I went straight to the downstairs bar, no line, and got the drinks I needed to have a good night. The club was spacious. They had the downstairs level which was more chill and then the upstairs level had the hip hop floor. It was packed, but good packed. Plenty of room to dance, and it was definitely poppin! I loved the mixes the dj was spinning as well. The wait was not long to get drinks upstairs either. The bathroom wait wasn't bad either. My friends and I had a blast. Definitely hit this club up if you are in North Beach!

u_H9oU4wuXLXzuXOz4XkQw.review_text: The good: So went here for my birthday and decided to get bottle service, let me just say bottle service everywhere is over rated however the women who is in charge with booking the service is incredible and will work with your budget! Plus they have THE cheapest bottle service prices in SF. The bathrooms are very clean and have a restroom attendant which makes things a bit awkward but they are extreamly helpful. The music was great! They play exactly what they have posted on their website events. Outdoor parking garage near by $15 bucks from 10pm-2am. Plus two pizza parlors directly next-door ; )   The bad: Club is rather small. There is a larger open area upstairs however, downstairs is very crowded.

TMr5z8JDuGPc0I-5WfpBMQ.review_text: I loved this place...why does it have such a low rating?  I've been here twice now, and both times I've had a blast.  The drinks we had were great, and the bartender was really nice and friendly... the dancefloor upstairs is always such a blast!  Love the little stage-ish platform area they have where girls can get up there and dance.  although some girls should not be allowed up there.... better than nothing!

ltb_FEBEf2-PuPqQQ4aSHg.review_text: Did I go to the right club? Or am I just really not picky?  I came for Ma$e last night and had a really good time. No one got bottle service except a couple groups so the other tables were open to sit around on and rest our feet. Music was really good (hip hop thank god. None of that EDM crap) and the dance floor was pretty big (and packed).  Only few down sides though were that drinks were slow and spensive and seriously what is UP with some of the females here? Catching HELLA attitude for no reason. Lighten up people. Life is not that serious!  Oh and PS, I was sober and still enjoyed myself so I feel even more odd writing a four star review amongst these 1 stars.

x1paA3aUHJTurbtFkBSOGg.review_text: Weird layout... I can't knock the spot based on the promoting group the night I went there so.... I'll try to play fair.  The place is okay, there are two bars, one in the front when you first walk in and then one in the back where the dance floor is and I'm guessing the main room of the venue.  There is staff in the bathroom which I didn't expect at a venue like this one..  Drinks were decently priced and not too skimpy like other places on Broadway.

Fv_u3q-SF-FKcbUXTyc6xQ.review_text: OMG! Is all I can say.  Jannos, Bennett and Karen = rockstars!  Super sweet, helpful and everything I could hope for.  Recently held a charity event that was held globally in over 250 cities.  Although our event was small this year, they helped us with everything from sound, to event staffing and more.   They have a great space, and amazing owners.  You can't go wrong when looking for a venue for your event.    Love these guys!

K5qQ09PsbW2Pscaf1fkmfA.review_text: This is one of the most ghetto clubs in the Bay Area. If the 30 cops waiting on standby out front (and all up and down Broadway) don't give it away, the crowd definitely will.   What's worse is, I showed up tonight trying to meet some friends, and the pre-door guy told me I couldn't come in with the shoes I was wearing. Online it says club attire- no sportswear. I was wearing $300 Diesel boots. I'll admit, I was wearing them out (pant bottoms inside the boots), but I promptly pulled my pants over the boot tops making them look like leather dress nice shoes, and the guy still said "NOPE". Like... you can't fool me with those nice shoes- I KNOW you're wearing boots under those pants.  I also had previously asked the actual door guy if they were passable to get in and he said "yes, they're fine".  After visiting another bar and coming back to get my friends, 2 fights broke out and people were taken away in handcuffs.  I suggest avoiding this place at all costs, if not for the club itself, but for the people that go there. You might swiftly be dragged into their world.

m9xPOrdllT14YsZIgr-LHA.review_text: An upgrade from the old spot for Sunday Bachata night.  For sure more space and more modern looking, oh and the restroom is cleaner and more spacious as well, at least for the lady's room.  Not sure about the drinks and such since I do not drink.

KTs38V5KZE7HLoSaq1vrKw.review_text: I had a good time at Atmosphere. My BF is not into North Beach, or prissy bars and clubs and even he had a good time. The DJ is hilarious, if you're looking for a good laugh (ever seen a DJ leave the booth to hit the dance floor because he is feeling his own set THAT much? This DJ did it every other song - it was hysterical.) The bartenders are great - especially Jay. He pours a great drink. He makes a Jay Special for the ladies, and different one for the guys. Both are great - pink and fruity for the girls, coke based and strong for the dudes. Ask for a Jay Special, just make sure to TIP HIM WELL! He rocks! I read a few people had trouble getting in for various reasons - I got to the club at 11ish, and had no problem with our party of 2 chicks and 2 guys - no cover, hardly a wait (maybe 10 mins). I would definetly go back to Atmosphere - I'd never pay more than $10 for any club, even Atmosphere - I honestly don't feel there's a reason to, especially with so many options in a big city like S.F.

VSRtEK_c84oJygZ0OX0Oqg.review_text: This place is kinda scary. Cover's not worth it. Last time I was there there were some local rappers that were performing for a while. I don't think any of the guys had a future as the next lil wayne. It was a saturday night, and the place was empty. The front room is nice though. Spacious.

S2fMpooI1l3HvSCDI94j7w.review_text: situated at the heart of strip club alley. when you get inside, the place has 2 levels the back is for the VIP and the dance floor. the front is more for a bar type feeling. the music kinda started slow. the music downstairs was better than the upstairs. the floor looked old the bathroom looked old. it's time for them to remodel. mind that we were on bottle service. the VIP was probably the only nice spot that it had. nice comfy couches but with the looks of the place i won't trust it either. i probably give it a second shot  oh there was tons of dudes that night and my home girl almost got kidnapped. if i didn't happen to find her. outside is not much different. there was fights left and right. do not stay in this area for longer than 30 mins. you're asking for trouble

RoA9mDVDKEwsdNrH4MH3IA.review_text: Right across from Apartment 24, Atmosphere is a nice lounge (not big) to just kick back with friends, but I wouldn't go there to dance, hence the 3 stars. The music on the first floor is better, or maybe because I prefer trance over rap. As for the cover charge, I don't know how much the cover charge is or how that works, we were on the guest list for an event.

F08gr8rwyB0J4FfnQG0zqQ.review_text: A few days before the event, I was having a discussion with a friend  about why she hates going to clubs in North Beach and much prefers the laid back bars of the Mission. I was open to fun anywhere though. Certainly, I've had a good time at Dragon Bar before.   But, damn, Atmosphere does not know how to keep a supportive clientele. Went to their "Grand Opening Party" on Saturday 10.18  - same night and same sad story as Quinn & Chefboyardee. I was really looking forward to checking out the new place from the 3 reviews I read here before going and knowing a bunch of my friends were also going to be there and the supposed free Patron!   Waiting in the cold for an hour (my mistake but that was because friends  were inside - apparently decided to skip the long guest list line and just pay the $20 cover) for a club so empty it couldn't warm me up was not how I had envisioned my fun night out. Mostly, what aggravates me was the lying and/or total lack of communication about why they were taking so long (apparently it takes more than 10 min to check for a person's name on the guest list) and what their cover charge was going to be (free - $10 - $15 - $20- your first born). I was also creeped out by the swiping of my driver's licence and taking of my picture before being allowed in - rather big brothery...  Could've been the mood all this put me in before getting in there but me (who normally likes dancing anywhere to whatever music - even Target to the embarassment of some companions) couldn't feel enough in me to do more than bob my head and pity the poorly-outfitted gogo dancers. I hate to be a negative nelly so, at least the drinks were well-poured and there was actually no line for the women's room!  After the debacle of Atmosphere, I have joined in my friend's distaste for North Beach's stripe shirted-hair gel-wish they were smart enough to be frat boys and the panty-showcasing hemlines (I kept wanting to ask if these girls knew their underwear was showing and to help them pull down the dresses). I may give North Beach another shot some day (when I miss seeing the Sheriff's bus battling it out with the party buses) but I can't go back to Atmosphere. Hope you have a better experience if you try it!

cFBkW7o2GnXtS1vpfWtK_w.review_text: I recently went here to check it out. It was OK during the time I went there. I went on a normal night they had some stuck up girls there just trying to dance I got used to hearing No that night lol.This place is big but the time I went they only had the 1st dance floor open. So my friends and I said Next Club! lol lets just hope my next experience is a better one. until next time I guess.

T1onvez6kj1aKChjFQCTOQ.review_text: Scenario: Barrister's Ball (aka Law Prom) and we're all dolled up.  Product: Drink prices were okay, as in not quite to $10.  The place was very swank with a dance floor upstairs and down.  Unfortunately, the upstairs wasn't open right away so it got pretty crowded early on.  Service:  No beer on tap.  Really?!?  The 'tenders did seem to hustle pretty well.  Atmosphere: The private part of the ball was nice.  Once opened to the public the collars started popping.  The neighborhood is Broadway, or is it broad way, as in a bunch of drunk broads, smoking, wearing baby doll dresses standing in your way in the middle of the street as you try to fend off the strip joint reverse-bouncers.  Uniquity: Moral of the story, wherever Barrister's Ball is, it's fun.  If you like fancy clubs check this out, but if you like plain old cheap beer dives like I do then there are plenty of better places just a couple blocks away.

iIQx9XCpNZHqPvhL4Cp1rA.review_text: I came to thisplace at 11:03 pm and guestlist closed at 11:00. While other clubs would charged the full cover (usually 20 dollars), this place kindly let us in for free.  That alone earns them 2 stars! I am a fan of hip hop, which was the type of music that was playing at that time (Friday night). Plus another star! Atmosphere had the friendliest bartender and bouncer I've ever met. One more star for that! Total of 4 stars.  They had a pool table but it was covered up the whole night. I'm not going to take away any stars because the table served as a good place to put down my drink while I was dancing the night away...

XzuGe_Q2b955aZQRHpSjRQ.review_text: Good lounge and space for a low-key party, though not necessarily for a crazy night out.  If you want wild, hit up one of many strip clubs next door along this street.  Either way, I give props to a venue that will host and support a non-profit organization event.  I came here last Friday for an SF Philanthro Productions event called "Ripple" sanfrancisco.philanthrop….  The space was set up with a huge Philanthro backdrop near the entrance and large LCD projectors in two rooms highlighting slide shows for the evening's cause (Kiva).  Pretty accommodating for a club.   Two bars and three rooms - 2 dance areas and 1 lounge.  The venue is minimalistic with some abstract art decor on the walls and in the bathroom stalls.  Music bumped a variety of hip-hop and early 90s - as in old school Madonna and Michael J.  I'm not sure if the DJs were from Philanthro or Atmosphere, but they rocked the house.  A sore note of the evening - one of the bartenders was pretty rude and ignored me for a good 15 minutes, which is a factor in the average rating.   Parking in the North Beach area, especially in the street, is a pain.  I save myself the agony and always head straight for the Parking Garage on Vallejo.

gjQ00L18PvAV450ZOfqYng.review_text: i don't like giving less than 4-star reviews.  like any other spot in SF, cover was 20 after 11 because we missed guestlist. parking was a pain in the ass because its on broadway st.  got inside and there were females galore.. then after about 45 mins the place was packed with fellas? smh. anyways, the drinks were strong enough and relatively cheap for a spot in SF on broadway... sutra closed down, I hope they don't take advantage of it and mark-up prices.  the honeys were bangin, everyone we came with was getting their sweeerve on, but i don't remember anything special about the DJ spinning that night. for $20 cover, you can take your crew over and see some showgirls' skin if you know what i mean.

Ve6Yq7F9Chf8N0JuJ7cQ2g.review_text: So, I've been here before when it was Zebra Lounge. Now that its Atmosphere, its way better.  They have a big dance floor upstairs with a stage. They also have different music playing as down stairs.I like the color combinations of purple, blue & pink lighting. Downstairs, they have several seating areas for bottle service. I can't say how much the drinks & how well they made it cause my friend was doing bottle service but I can say It was my first time at Atmosphere & bottle service SUCKED! Make sure your server is doing his/her job if you decide to do bottle service.

jlafaE37kwj1jVAkJ6emtg.review_text: -don't like any clubs on this street -only been there once and once is enough -was a slow night and the crowd was ghetto and the whole place seemed dirty

zpjCezhFtGI0vXEfI4Ni2g.review_text: If I could give this place less than 1 star I would. Here's why..  Was on the guest list, still had to pay $15.  Ordered a drink, was told it was $8, gave the bartender a $20, only to receive $7 back. Then was totally ignored by the bartender when I wanted to get my other $5 back.  Music was... ehh... I know being retro is cool right now, but all of the songs being played were ones you'd hear at any of my high school dances...  Overall I don't think I'd go back. I'd rather spend that $28 elsewhere...

q29DsL5xmpdV42bJ6XLkBg.review_text: K first of all DON'T love Broadway, because non SF locals come here thinking its Hollywood. BTW, it's NOT!!   K the first time I came here. I did NOT love it! The second time was even worst! (Although both times I came I didn't have to wait inline and just walked in) But the bouncer the second time I came here, was trying to be hardcore by ignoring me because I made a funny comment. Come on take a joke and smile, cause your job isn't really that serious! Were you that picked on in HS?? LOL Then the music was horrible. Sorry, I'm not a Dance or "Fist Pumper" kind of girl. Then the wanna-be Hiphop room was just a big hallway where people are constantly shoving and passing through to get to the Dance room. And they weren't even playing hiphop the whole time. Also NO ONE says excuse me or sorry here. (Douche Bags and Douche Baguettes)   The best part of the night though was this HUGE framed mirror where people kept thinking it was an opening to get to the other side of the room. emJtL3gEv5xceUSVVK76Zw.review_text: Went on a Saturday, was on g-list, made it in fine, had a good time, music was just so-so.

hLGJeXpZI8S-rCMIa2_M2w.review_text: I did my research ahead of time by checking out the reviews.  Well turns out I ignored all of the bad ones and went to the club anyway because Chrisette Michele was "performing" there and I thought "this can't be THAT bad." WELL IT WAS. This place is a full out CON.   Here's why it SUCKS ass:  1. I received an email from the club saying that on Thursday May 7th there was going to be a "Very special performance by Grammy Award winner Chrisette Michell, also appearing Jamie Foxx and Day 26 (Making the Band)."  CON - I called ahead, I emailed, just to make sure... They confirmed Chrisette Michell was performing. Did she perform? NOPE! It wasn't till about 12:30 AM that she got on stage after the announcer said "here's what we've all been waiting for!" and she said"thanks for supporting me and my album" and said a couple other words for about a minute and that was ALL. She got off the stage and a bunch of local rappers got up and started goofing off.  No Jamie Foxx - total lie to get people to come.  No Day 26 but who cares about them! haha  2. "Free guest list before 11 pm"  CON - We were on the guest list and got stamped outside as being confirmed. At about 10:30 we got in the FIRST set of doors.  Then as we were about to go inside, a new lady said "What's your name? Oh you're not on the guest list" and I said "Well how did I get this stamp on my wrist then? I saw my name on the list" and she goes "Ok, well you're not on the list. 10 dollars each."  So apparently they decide who they wanna charge and how many "different" lists they're going to have.  What's the point of getting on the list if they are going to screw you over?  3. The pictures on the website portraying a new, cool club, with nice lighting and sexy "atmosphere."  LIE! - This place is SUPER lame inside. There are two levels and the first level is not impressive at all.  Their fish tank was about the only thing I liked. There's paint chipping. The floors dirty. The lighting sucks - WAY TOO BRIGHT and awkward. And above the fish tank they just put some weird slab of wood to make it blend in with the wall. SUPER tacky!  Upstairs was a larger room for dancing... It was OK. Bathrooms had attendants in them trying to help you dry your hands which is unnecessary cause the place isn't even nice.   4. The drinks were OK.  They were pricey. My boyrfriend liked his rum and coke.  But my drink was WEAK.  5. The people there were all too trashed to realize how stupid this place really is.  6. Creepy old guys standing off to the side eye-f*cking girls...   7. Had maybe 2 or 3 good songs that played between two hours  8. Place was never PACKED and when we left at 12:45 AM and there was still a HUGE line to get in.   9. Bad location.  Trashy area.  Not at all in the cool parts of North Beach.  10. They treat their club like we're in Hollywood.  Frisking people.  Taking EVERYONES photo as you get your ID scanned.  5 or more bouncers with ear pieces. Come on. It's not that serious.  So overall, they have a big ol scam going on here.  They're making major moola off drunk people's stupidity to come here. And unfortunately non-drunk folks who bought into the few "good reviews" and the pictures - that'd be me! ARRRRRRG!    Save yourself the money, time and annoyance - GO SOMEWHERE ELSE.

2sVdJp360sdA7rPBEgnPqw.review_text: My tweet to DJ Tina T during NYE while at Atmosphere:  @djtinat why is some fat asian guy dj'ing at Atmosphere and not you?!?!  Her reply to me at the end of the night:  @briant***** hahahaha! Happy New Year :) Hope we met at some point tonight.  1) She didn't answer my question. I still to this day don't understand why a fat asian guy was DJ'ing on the second floor while I saw DJ Tina T just standing there in the back. I really wanted to see her do her thing while I was still sober and coherent. I didn't pay for bottle service to see some unknown dude push play on his iTunes playlist!  and 2) I really wish I did meet her that night because she is damn cute!  My NYE night here was full of questions just like the one I posed to DJ Tina T...  "Why is the line for the people who purchased bottle service moving slower than the super long general admission line?"  "How come there's a couple dressed up like Adam & Eve just standing there and not doing anything?"  "Why are the balloons for the balloon drop only situated on the far end of the room?"  "Why is the venue so small?"  "How come there's no House music being played?!?!"  Fortunately though, even with all the negativity floating around in my head, I had a phenomenal time! Karen and Marissa were excellent hostesses. They were prompt with all of our requests and were extremely nice and accommodating. The crowd was very diverse, which is a huge plus in my book. The people I met were really friendly and I had no sightings of any douche-baggery being committed by anyone. My friends that I hung out with...what can I say...I wouldn't want to have spent NYE with any other group of friends! It was definitely a memorable night!  Now if we can take all the positive things and put them in a different venue and call that place Atmosphere as well, then we're onto something!

jW24T6R4_lSFUXQZEe2Jzg.review_text: You ever meet someone who seems like they would be a great person from pictures but once you get to see who they are on the inside they are just worst person? That is how I felt about Atmosphere.   The legitimate conversation that happened before trying this place. I heard they get major hip hop performers to perform there and its actually hip hop in SF!  Is it worth dealing with the people? Well its located near some other bars so maybe we could save the night! Is it worth dealing with the people there? Well we are already walking there so its too late now.  Still is it worth dealing the people there? It wasn't.   The crowd at Atmosphere just kind of makes you feel uncomfortable. For the setup that they have at the club it really should be much better. The harsh reality and the truth of why most clubs don't play exclusively hip hop is because they don't want the crowd that comes to that place. It can be diverse and some really enjoy hip hop but it attracts so many people who either want to start shit or steal things that it is not worth wading your way through that mess. And this is not a race thing. The sketchy people were of all colors and sizes.   As many said below the staff feels like they are a big deal for what they are trying to do. I appreciate the dress code etc in any place but the way they toss people out of line and inspect you it makes you even more upset when you realize the club is nothing worth getting into. I can put up with this crap to get into the Grand because at least i know there is an experience inside. Here its like getting felt up to get to a delayed flight at the airport. You just don't get why they were so rough and you feel sad because you had to go through it for nothing.   Once inside the ticket lady immediately tries to take you money and she can't even believe people found out about the guest list let alone use it and is very reluctant to let you in for free. We came on a performance night which increased the number of people but it was still disappointingly few people. There is no way this place fills up on a  Friday or Saturday on it own which is another reason not to risk your night unless you are going to the many nearby strip clubs which I imagine many are.   There are some photo areas near the entrance and the bar is small but good enough to serve the small crowd. No issues with this area. I gave the place two stars because I appreciate any place that actually has room to dance. Their back room is actually really nice and has a large dance floor. The problem is there is no one there you will want to dance with or feel safe dancing with without a safe word.. Seriously ladies if you go here you will get outright grabbed and scoped for hours. It was unnerving to watch the gays swoop in here.   The performance was cool as hell though and you are right up close to the performer with the stage built into the back of the dance floor. The DJ was also amazing. Some of the best hip hop set list i have heard in the city.   But it was not worth everything happening around you. It all felt like it was an attempt at a party that never really started. If you are into hip hop and don't care about how bad the crowd is around you then you can take the dive and go for this place but no matter the positives it is not worth feeling like you could have had a better time anywhere else in the city.

9P8-9EUP-aEnuisqUYt5jQ.review_text: Warning** mixed drinks are hella expensive here. Just order a beer for $6.  Lots of cool wanna be dancers here. I had an overall good time. Maybe that's simply because by the time I got here I had a couple of drinks under my belt.  Pretty big dancefloor! The lights were basically on and there was no "club lighting" which would have been cool. The floor was kinda dirty too. I think they need to turn the lights down and add some lighting and it will feel more like a club here!  Ok.. it's the best club I've been to on Broadway yet.. but that doesn't say much for Broadway if you know what I mean.   Only come here if you're stuck on Broadway. By no means should you come here intentionally.

nEl2xgE6EBrIU9axpW_gmA.review_text: parking still sucks but the place is looking better.  i had to park pretty much by COIT tower this time which is fine for me but for the folks who come to party in heels... smh... i feel for you. on another note do they teach you how to perpendicular park in SF? i know that i don't even require parallel parking anymore in the driving tests but seriously, perpendicular parking was KEY tonight.  parking aside - we got to club and were happily surprised. well i was anyways. they redid the front of the house. they got rid of the pool table. created more private seating. moved the dj booth and elevated it. now it looks like a real party in the front and then another party in the back! unlike mullets which only have a party in the back.  QUICK TIP: there is a spot on the dance floor that never gets hot! it's near the fan and in front of the air vent. if we are there on the same night i'll probably fight you for it, but i highly recommend it because you can stay cool as you dance the night away.  the drama however continues... but that won't stop me from coming back. it's part of the fun i suppose.   until next time,  cheers!

Si9pln8-mnfxD4T1By3SiQ.review_text: second spot we went to last night.  typical bar/lounge/club spot.  they played a variety of music from west coast gangsta rap to electro remixes and mashups.  very roomy place and the crowd was diverse.  the venue reminds me of busby's east in west LA.

Paid 20 to get in and they didn't even give it back, mind you the upstairs was closed so we WERE STUCK DOWNSTAIRS CRAMPED AND STINKY!!!!! The place is wack!!!! Do not waste ur time or money

KpT04gs-GMsjG8lQVkWtaQ.review_text: Got bottle service but they ran out of tables so they gave us the corner of the bar. Weird but it worked. The guys at the door were polite but only because my boyfriend knew them.  Super crowded. Bartenders were quick with serving drinks. Bathroom lady is super nice! Plays good hip hop but I always hate the crowd. Almost every time I come there is always a fight at the end of the night. This time I saw some girls get dragged down some steps.

o-NPgmrcihUoE0afXAmoPg.review_text: Fun! I was a little apprehensive at first because it's in North Beach which really isn't my scene. I was pleasantly surprised! It looks very small when you first walk in, but there is a separate dance floor that is pretty big (for SF). When we first arrived, there was open bar which was pretty awesome (we scored 2 drinks before it ended). I guess if you go in with low expectations, you'll probably have a good time. My only suggestion is to go early so you avoid paying cover. They move the line slowly, so get there by 10:15pm. Good times!

iv-U8zzyNb8Fh0RXQEfhhg.review_text: Crazy RATCHET up in there last night! No lie, some girl's weave was foreal getting tossed around the dance floor. Cool place though.

Uban-MJKpA8DVMfdpf-KCg.review_text: Went to Atmosphere for the 1st time last nite (06/19/10). After hearing mixed reviews of the place, I decided to have a fun nite out with the girls.  Got there before 11pm to get in free on the guestlist.  The people at the door were friendly. The first room was a chill spot with a smaller bar.  Free champagne and cupcakes!  There were only 2 bartenders working at the time and it got a little bit of a wait.  Disappointed that they were limited on what they had and couldn't make me a mojito. Boo! My sister's Tokyo Ice Tea tasted like sewer water! Im not exaggerating.  The bar counters smelled like old wet rags.    Finally they opened up the bigger dance room at around 12pm. It was a nice big area to dance and their dj booth and bar was beautiful! The music wasn't much to my liking at first, but then it picked up and they played more hip hop r&b mash ups.  The crowd was decent.  Seemed like its a spot for big groups to meet up and have a fun time. So if you're looking to have a fun event with 15+ of your best homies, this is a good spot for that.   Crowd that nite was a mix of asians filipinos latins  Overall, I probably wouldn't go to this club again.  I had to drink more than I planned just to enjoy my time.  I'm sure people have a great time at this place but it just wasn't to my liking. To each his own!

TFpNMh-yRcPiWcFMuIY2bg.review_text: Came here for a friends birthday and it was a pretty fun place.  It was empty when we first arrived but filled up rather quickly.  I liked that they had a sale on Belvedere ($5 for a shot or drink) til 11, I would have been in love if it was Grey Goose! Watch out for that tricky mirror by the pool table, I watched 2 girls almost walk into it thinking that it was a doorway into another room. :)

qkelo15wZAzyC_lPB5ODkQ.review_text: I've been to Atmosphere 4 times, mainly for birthdays. I think this club is a popular choice for many because it is spacious and the music is top 40 hip-hop.  People say this club is ghetto, yes, but I've had good times here!  There are 2 floors. The first floor is chill, due to the smaller dancing area and dim lighting. The second floor is the main floor. The dance floor is pretty big. There's a stage where girls can slut it out. There are two VIP sections upstairs, one next to the stage and one in the back near the bathrooms. If you are getting VIP, I'd recommend requesting the one next to the dance stage so that it's closer to the dance floor and you can see more action. My friend got a table near the bathrooms, and it's pretty far from the dance floor. I felt disconnected from the fun and our group. Also, I believe VIP gets only 5 wristbands per table, so if you are trying to sneak the rest of your group to the table, you should share wristbands because they are strict with entrance.  I came here 3 times with my name on guestlist. Once, I waited in line around 10:20, thinking I would get in before 11 for free. Wrong!! They held up the line to after 11, and I had to pay $20.  Disappointing!  Another time, I came here with a partybus at 11:30 and it was empty. The busy-ness varies and I'd say it is busier on Sat nights than Fri nights. Also, they occasionally have open bar 10-11, but you have to sign up for those.  The crowd here is pretty ghetto! But that doesn't mean you won't have fun! One time, a rap group called Tha Outfit performed on stage and made it rain $1 bills!! I got caught $9 from that night!!!  Oh, and a black guy asked my friend to be in his porn production. Told ya, it's ghettto!!!  One last thing: I contacted them to request free entrance for our partybus to be extended from 11 to 11:30. I didn't expect a response, but the guy emailed me back the same day and accommodated my request. I liked that they actually communicate back, unlike anywhere else....  I would only come here if it's free!

BzjscnV_Qg2qqri91lwZUg.review_text: This is regarding Saturday night April 17 2010:  If i had a choice to give a big fat zero star, ATMOSPHERE WOULD BE IT!  RUDE RUDE RUDE bouncers!  These bouncers were HOSTILE and major a55 h0les!!  Go somewhere else!  This club is BY FAR the dirtttiest club on the Broadway strip.  And that's saying a lot since there are a few strip clubs on Broadway.  Venue being dirty is one thing... but to deal with the mean bouncers/security brought this club to a whole new level of disgust and unprofessionalism.  I'm so disgusted by the bouncers attitude!! Big over sized Samoians' who were power tripping and being extremely rude for no apparent reason!  They started to cuss at us, I have never felt so attacked.  We did nothing wrong!  We were 10 polite, tiny petite Asian ladies who were dressed to impressed, ready to get in and say Happy BIrthday to a friend who bought bottle service.  MInd you, we were 10 SOBER girls who were ready to spend the money on drinks!  The bouncers were so difficult to deal with!  I gave up and walked down to Sutra, where the bouncers let me in without any troubles!  Atmosphere gets two dumbs down for me.    If you are looking for a good time, go somewhere else!!!  You will regret wasting your money and time for a venue who doesn't give a sh1t about your patronage.  Atmosphere will not appreciate your money nor your attendance!

yqZBhTWtVjEwvdlcIdfxxA.review_text: Terrible.   The only reason I came here was to watch my homie perform. The BOUNCER put hands on me and threw me across the floor instead of politely asking me to not be in the VIP area without a wristband.  She started chest bumping me when I told her "don't put your hands on me" and she said multiple times "what are you gonna do about it??" tGxhVMTDSdG1n5oJH0k0Ug.review_text: It was a refreshing way to get away from Downtown SJ with the gang. I don't have a paramount story to tell you about Atmosphere, so I'm just going to lay it out flat.   The pro's of this place are apparent as seen in other reviews , the dance floor is spacious and the bartenders  friggin' rock my socks! The crowd welll.....since it was a Hybrid 10 year anniversary party it was inevitably an Asian invasion. Very nice decor inside and Jeri Lee was go-go dancing! They also have a Coat-check for 2-3 dollars, so don't hoochify yourself as soon as your step out of the car, wait till you get inside because as we all know the city is chill-ay.  Con's- line took 216541654 years to get into. My goodness, i had to stand near the wall of smokers blowing their cancerous fumes into my face for far too long and to have to pay 20 dollars! Then,  finally after getting into the club at 11:45 and getting a few drinks and our "freak on", the lights abruptly flashed on at 1:30 exactly. Wait..I'm in the City aren't i? Oh well, luckily the place is surrounded by lardaceous places, taqueria's and greasy pizza joints, that allow you to enjoy yourself for a extra hour or so. Make sure you bring cash! the ATM fee's charge you up the wazoo!

4r-8Ty-TB-NOX5huxXY_hQ.review_text: i've had better. the crowd was mediocre at best. drinks and djs were aweful.   i'll pass this place next time around.

VvSxtZITEAopE1nRUGqfNg.review_text: Giving this place a one star because I have to. I went in there with a group of 16 people with a limo company. To get in we had to waste a good 20 minutes because they wanted to talk to the owner/driver personally before we got in the club. They handed out tickets to 15 people and we were missing one ticket. They argued that we had to pay 20 for the admission although we had wristbands and stamps from the limo.  These guys just want to make money period. They try every hook and crook. After spending about $500 in the bar we decided for a smoke about 14 of us went out as advised by one of the bouncers and when we tried reentering they wanted us to pay $20 a head again. I was like this is not happening. After speaking to 6 bouncers I spoke to this very arrogant manager/supervisor claiming we all have coats inside and we are not leaving without them. After spending a few minutes waiting for his response we talked to the cops that were outside, told them what the situation was they forced them to accept us back in the club again. This place has a stage where apparently they only allow  ladies wearing close to nothing on it. After being pulled up by 3 girls a friend of mine was thrown off stage by bouncers. We told them if they do not allow guys on stage they should post a note. We also said if there were any injuries coming from that push, we would file charges.  There are a lot of clubs in this district I would not recommend this piece of shit place to anyone because of their overpriced drinks, a full line up of staff that works in every way possible to get in your wallet. The people that come in here are great and friendly for the most part. Their restrooms are in the corner and you have bouncers right outside trying to throw people off the club for apparently being a little drunk but if you walk with the bouncer to the bar and order drinks you are good to stay. They close at 1:45 A.M. and have a lineup of rude staff up your butt to get you out. One of my friends accidentally left a coat there at the check-in and we called the club after we got out and back home only to hear that the coat was not there. How do you give out somebody's belongings when we still have the check-in stub.  I would rather not go out partying then go to this place ever again.

l7tsWZEIc8b2WXPYX2xS9w.review_text: it's decent...  the line wasn't long at all around 10:30 and even though my friend wasn't on the list, we swore up and down that she was and they let her in for free which was nice.   don't order a greyhound though because they don't have grapefruit juice. don't order a harvey wallbanger either because they don't have galliano. don't order a hennessy sidecar either cuz that shit will FUCK YOU UP. the drinks are strong and considering it's in North Beach, I'd say they're reasonably priced.   the crowd consisted mostly of people from my high school (and I'm 25!) so if I had to use one word to sum up the crowd, I'd say Asian (I went to Lowell =P). the room with reserved tables played electronic/techno music and the other one played hip hop/top 40. there's also another room in the back but it was closed off. looked nice though!

jGepPl5jibnjaG0GztTPfw.review_text: The place bites, Rude management that did not give me the time of day or respond to my complaints. I would never send anyone to visit the club Atmosphere.

zZha2AcC31exjvxun055PA.review_text: Went here on a friday night for a couple friends' birthdays.  When we arrived it was chaos outside -- people standing everywhere and a line wrapping around the building. Seemed like it was 'cracken' inside since there were so many people outside. We were able to get in via bottle service, but if it weren't for that I don't think i'd stand in that ridiculous line to get in here.  It's a two level place and the upstairs is the main dance floor. Bottle service has two areas, one down stairs and one upstairs.  The one down stairs was dark and....dark.  The upstairs bottle service area was much larger, but required you to show your wrist band before entering....It also smelled like hard boiled eggs in that area.   **TIP: get the shots upstairs -- the ones down stairs were skimpy.   When we first got in, there werent a lot of people there (mind you this was around 11pm) ... i understand they have to mediate how many people come in at a time, but it seemed like more yelling went on outside versus getting people in.   Smoking section was small so we had to wait a while to get out there.  Overall, it was cool -- your average club. Top 40s music. Not so cool when you're just sandwiched in between other sweaty drunk people -- it got pretty packed. The venue was nothing spectacular or memorable, but it was decent.   **TIP: finding a cab after the club here is ridonkulous!!! It took us nearly an hour to find a cab so take a walk and grab some food...

RtHD1eQpqMJPSD21PfY9lw.review_text: Hate to say it but I don't know how else to describe this club but ghetto.  I went last Friday for a friends birthday and was VERY disappointed.  For the way it was advertised, you would think it was a really nice and classy club...wrong.  The venue is definitely beautiful so I expected much more of an 'atmosphere', however, when we pulled up I already knew what it was going to be.  To start, they really need to establish some kind of a dress code; the flyer gave the impression that it was an all white party and said to dress nicely, so I came dressed nicely but before I even walked up to the club I saw girls in jeans and guys in hoodies- wtf?  That is not club attire.  Once inside, there was a $20 charge because Los Raca's was performing (I didn't get to find out if they did or not) which was fine but for $20 I don't expect people to be dressed like they're going to a kickback, it just throws off the whole vibe!  While in there my friend and I met 2 really cool young lawyers (dressed for a nice club, of course) who were also shocked by the feel of the club and so was everyone I was with!    On top of that, my drink was so strong it tasted like a straight glass of vodka, I had to tell them to add some spritzer in it!  Luckily I was already a little tipsy so I just gave it to a friend.    Everyone keeps talking about the dance floors but I only got to see one of them which I assume was the main room which was ALL hip hop but not even cool hip hop, like, old school hip hop.  No Tyga, no Wiz, no Drake, no recent TOP 40's except for "Slow Down" and some other hyphy shit which is cool but, not every damn song!  I asked the DJ to play some Rihanna so me and my friends could actually party which he kindly did...while dancing my iPhone 4s and a little $$ fell out of my pocket, which I didn't realize until the end of the song.  Looked down, it was gone.  Called it, it was shut off and I haven't seen it since.  After that, I had had enough and went home.  So less than an hour after arriving I was out 60 bucks, a cell phone, and a Friday night - talk about a bad night.

0QeJC2inz6P-OVzROU_LNw.review_text: We had wristbands but it appears that the club had no idea what to do. What ended up happening? They made us form a line next to the line of people already waiting to get in. The security guy checked our ID's and had us continue on. Upon entering this joint, there's this smoky and dark setting that just hits you, creepers standing on the sidelines observing who is going in. There is a bar w/in a few feet from the entrance so it was definitely a challenge to walk through and get to the stairs. Yes, this place has 2 stories, each playing different beats. The bathrooms are located upstairs as well and it appears that the door is to be remained open while a quiet and old Asian woman cleans up after each use of the sink and hand delivers you a paper towel... there is a tip jar for her "services" and I find that quite odd.   The music upstairs was horrible. The music downstairs were dance-able and they were playing some hit 90's- 112! I don't know what it is but I did not get a good groove on when upstairs but that's where my group was to be posted. We were among the firsts to dance, my group. Then it started to get crowded, very crowded. The spillage of drinks written in some of the reviews were no joke- some dumbass girl spilled some of her drink on me and some douche spilled his drink over me because he tried to get me to dance all up on him- I don't think so, aashole. This is a club and I came to dance, if I wanted to get frisky, I would have opted for actual sex. Seriously- nobody genuinely dances anymore? Is it grinding and humping part of it now? Does it make one feel or look cool doing it? Because I did not have 1 decent dance the whole entire night. Was it the crowd at this particular club? Not sure but it scarred me from going dancing unless I am w/ my significant other.   There is a platform/stage area on the second floor and I guess one needs to wear extremely short ass skirts or dresses or shorts to be up there.. apparently no style of dancing is ok too.. as long as you show skin, it's all that matters. The VIP area was blocked off w/ a thing and there is a security lady that checks you in so that was a good thing.   The bar area can get crowded but I actually stood there, wishing my night was over w/ already. At least the bartender was nice. I wanted water, I thought I was going to get charged for a bottled water but no, I was given a glass of ice water w/ a straw, no charge!   There is a seating area on the first floor and I spent the last 40 minutes rereading my texts and resting my poor feet that has been on 3in. heels the entire night. There is a covered pool table right in the area too and some used that as a dancing dirty platform.   No ins and outs here. I wanted to leave the club to get something to eat and come back but apparently I couldn't do that. I had to endure 2hrs and some minutes here.   My God. Never. Again. Never.

awqtQmC1QoUxOdmdQoeirQ.review_text: I find it a little creepy when there's that one old white dude sitting alone at the bar oggling girls. And this is the type of place where you'd find guys like that.   Last time I came here for Halloween it was packed (expected). Then I came here again on a rainy Friday and it was completely empty. Except for the creepy white guy at the bar.   Overall since it's so large compared to other places in NB, I guess you can't really go wrong as long as you know what to expect in terms of the crowds. But then again because it is so large - it takes a while to fill up, which means you probably shouldn't come here anytime before midnight.

AEN3VLT7Lh0UTJUch3JiqQ.review_text: Eh... Better places to go.  You think if you rent out the floor of a club you would get decent service. Not here. Do not rent out Atmosphere for a private event, you will be disappointed.  Music was a little dated and the DJ, at a private event, was not responsive to requests despite several people making the same request.  I asked the bartender for a martini, it was mixed with no vermouth and in a plastic cup...  I asked the bartender for a cucumber martini... I was informed they don't serve cucumber martinis. The bar was NO frills.  I asked the bartender for a lemon drop, the first attempt was served in a plastic cup that was warm and tasted like sanitizer (because they pulled it out of their dishwasher mid-cycle, that is normally a health code violation and the taste of sanitizer is not a good thing). After informing the bartender I got major attitude, she remixed the drink and put salt on the rim instead of sugar!  Finally, people were at the private event that were not on the list. If I wanted a random guy to proceed to hump me without an invitation and then follow me around, not taking the hint, I would not have gone to a private party where there was supposed to be door control.   I repeat, do not rent out Atmosphere for an event. Hopefully our party got their C game staff and they have a better staff for their "real patrons" because that was clearly their attitude about our private event.

EUAtnptDql_tMRsETuELkg.review_text: Came here May 27th. Im from San Diego County so Im used to different style clubs. This one isnt bad, it was just plain. Weird type of plain. It wasnt fancy but it wasnt ghetto. It wasnt packed but it was sure not empty either. Tough to explain, maybe because i was already buzzin, as usual. I would recommend it. 20 dollar price tag is a bit steep but im sure you will have fun. didnt see any fights that night. This place, obviously, does not compare or come close to Vegas. If you visit San Fran, check it out, youll have a good, weird fun time.

uKkNmBfkMjFQKKpDSe4vLw.review_text: I came here for a friend's bday last Saturday. Luckily we were on a guest list so no crazy waiting in the line that turns into the alleyway next to the building. I saw this man rummaging  through the trash bin like 30 feet away from us...creeeeeeeepy. Or maybe he was just taking out the trash.   There were three "areas" to the club. One techno/trance-ish room with a fish tank (my favorite part of the room but they need more fish. However all the beats and pounding vibrations might stress them out).  The two other areas were a mix of R&B and hip hop. The floors were hella slippery though, it hard to get your groove on if you had even babyheels on. The music was alright, I was fascinated by this muppets music video they had projected onto the walls. It was so cute.   Pros: - strong drinks - fun music - $3 coat check - friendly crowd  Cons: - slippery floor - small bathrooms (3 stalls max I think) - small-ish venue (it was comparable to a club in HK) - slight concern for animal cruelty to the fish  I loved my ladies' night though. Everyone else got messed up quick. There are convenience stores located CONVENIENTLY nearby for a water or something to sober drunk pals up :) Lots of cops around though. Behave or be careful!

bm2DqfP4P454FjEtCbZdkQ.review_text: I came here for a friend's birthday celebration and I actually had a really good time. I want to warn you though, our party reserved a table for bottle service, so my review may be slightly bias due to the special treatment that we got.  Anyhow...my first impression upon stepping into the club, was that it was really small. I did not realize that there was a second floor, until our waitress escorted us to a closed off section upstairs. What I really liked was the size of our booth. Usually clubs have tiny booths that can only fit like five people. Our booth at Atmosphere fit about twice the number of people comfortably. We were right next to the go-go dancers too, so we had a good view.   The dance floor was really spacious and I was able to dance without bumping into anyone. The restroom was closely located and there were enough stalls to prevent long lines. Overall, the club was pretty clean and nicely decorated. I wouldn't mind partying here again.

cXoKpS2xgsAuZlmR__Dm-g.review_text: I hit atmosphere after a night of club/lounge hopping with some friends.  We spent most of the night at Apt.24 across the street, then hopped to Sutra for just a few mins, then walked into Atmosphere.  It was later in the night so by then all clubs should be bumpin, but it was sort of... empty.  The crowd was kind of...sketch as well, probably because they had enough alcohol in them by then.  We tried to dance for a bit and have some fun but we pretty much called it a night soon after.... Not sure if its any better earlier in the night?

yz0T3HS6ikX11F5o6T6SWA.review_text: I've been to almost EVERY club in SF...so I have an idea of what to expect and what to look out for once I go to a new venue.  (1) Line: It was a 1000+ invite private party which I was invited to, I was definitely skeptical about getting in. Luckily, the bday boy was able to pull people as he felt appropriate and the general line moved rather quickly. Was out of the cold in 5 minutes. Doormen were very courteous.   (2) Bar: Great service, super speedy. What do you expect when you go to a party with tons of people, instant drinks? People were nice about shifting positions and once I got to the bar...I was able to order 10 drinks without hesitation.   (3) Music: The best I've heard in a long time. Usually when you go to clubs and they advertise hip-hop/top-40...some awkward mix of random rock/trance funks up the mood. There were distinct, separate moments for mash-ups and awesome r & b throwbacks, keeping the crowd happy overall.   (4) VIP support: If you get a table, you're treated like a king. No wait, instant service, hassle-free pricing. A+  (5) Crowd: Depends on the promoter. Again, I went on a night of a private party so it was entirely up to the bday boy to supply the list.   Overall, this is one of the cleanest, classiest North Beach lounges so far. It definitely surpassed the old Zebra and Infinity lounge setup and I can imagine myself visiting again without hesitation. Consider it the SF club experience without the rude attitude.

9XqGrgCmZ-EfNFhz1xU5BQ.review_text: Absolutely horrible. Went for a birthday and will never go back. Crap DJs who start to play a good set and then just when everyone was getting into it, play a crap song. Should have known better since its tucked between strip clubs so it was basically full of the type of people who frequent strip clubs. Dont let the photos lie to you! Unless you like to get touched by random men grabbing your arm as you walk by...  I dont recommend it.

rLrpUn3XucGA9LBktJWQqQ.review_text: THIS IS NOT WORTH BOTTLE SERVICE. We came there last night with a group of 15 people and ordered a few bottles. They actually HELD the bottle service line outside. As we waiting impatiently to get in I see all these people (must be "friends" of the owner but shouldn't they worry more about the people dropping the most MONEY?) get in with no wait and no line. I asked the bouncer what was the hold up a few times and he acted as if the VIP tables were so busy, but when we finally got in we were only one of the TWO tables occupied.   The bathroom was more disgusting than a regular club restroom, but the crowd was decent. However,  I would have been happier if I celebrated my grad night at a place that actually appreciates money from table service.

EiwxlbR8fb68lMgEXhcWKA.review_text: Perhaps this is unheard of, but for once I am about to rate a club 4 stars and we're not even in Vegas.  I had plenty of doubts about this place since I've never heard of it and it's got average reviews. My friend claimed they were having a hosted bar and put us all on the guest list.  We actually arrived at the club early (oh my) and I was, quite literally, the first person in line. The ID and guestlist checking began, but for some reason the first three people in our party were not on the list although the rest were. However, the bouncer was nice and let us in anyway. Once inside, they had catered food! Yes we are talking shrimp cocktails, sliders, cupcakes, munchies, calamari, bruschetta, the works!  I personally have not seen this at a club before, so I skidaddled over for some cupcakes and beef skewers and took off to the bar. Gin, rum and vodka (and mixed drinks with those) were free between 10-11 so we got our drinks on. Some people a little more so than others ...  The downstairs area had a nice lounge section with a fish tank (and probably some highly stressed out fish ...) Upstairs dance floor wasn't bad either. Go go dancers and good music. Pretty good!

Xmo_NEfUp5YFzGJmwN11jQ.review_text: Probably the worst club I have ever been to in the city.  The place is ugly and it attracts the ghetto of the bay area.  Multiple fights in one night and I'm assuming this is a regular problem cuz there are a million and one cops outside of this club.    So many nicer places to go for a fun night out in the city...

wgrQxY37BGWxGCLr3wG7Gw.review_text: The music was not the bomb, and the service was mediocre.  The bouncer was too cool for school (at least, HE thot he was), and basically set the tone for the pretentiousness inside.  The best part of the evening was watching folks practically run into the garage door-sized mirror by the pool table thinking it was a doorway to the room behind it.  If you decide to come to Atmosphere, the spot to be is 3 ft from this mirror.  Any view will do =P
